column10: I've only played this for a short time, but in that time, as a new player, i can say the new player experience is atrocious; there is zero easing into the battle, no new player match making, to let you get better with other players on your level and move you up in ranking difficulty as you get better. It's 0 to 100 in one click. There is also an heck of a lot of graphics errors that occur in battle.
very fun

reviewing after feb 22nd blog post:

I have alot more hours into the game than this states, I bought this twice on Epic and on Steam and collective between both accounts, im sitting around level 240. 
What has me upset about the recent update is a few things so ill list:

- Cheating; cheating is a hugely widespread issue and the sad fact is, developers do not act against reports. They don't. Cheaters I've met carry on cheating the next day and nobody at Torn Banner gives a fuck. Their implying case that its some kind of priority of theirs is laughable and ridiculous. 

- Denied mod support: despite the community wanting mod support so custom servers could be utilised, Torn Banner announced that (despite the easy implimentation) they would never add mod support into Chivalry 2's lifespan. This just sucks.

- Negative Tweaks: the developers thought it was a great idea to purposely mess up the spawn system so players spawn behind walls and often far far away from the objectives. The theory ive been given by a veteran player is that they wanted new players to experience more of the map and to make matches last longer -  despite them nerfing the amount of gold and XP you get. 

- Tenosia update: by far, the Tenosia update is the community's most disliked update. Lacking content, annoying voicelines and EXTREMELY unbalanced maps - the developers fell really short on that update. Since then, they have not tried to solve any of those issues.

- Lack of Support to Gamemodes: they recently teased theyd be doing a FFA map. This is amazing - but its been a long time coming and they haven't done anything to other gamemodes for a long while. The focus on shit like peasant last man standing is just really dumb and the thing is, I meme when I play. I never play serious so playing peasant would be right up my alley - but we already have that shit and we could just experience that in a subclass or some shit. It'd be nice to maybe get *just* a siege map, where its a TDM obj kinda thing of just a castle and short match fun shit. but yeah, lack of FFA support is sad too.

Don't get me wrong, I love this game. It's why I bought it twice and have even gifted it to a friend to play with me too - but its just a sad case of developers not listening or caring about their community. 

This just isn't worth it at full price and i'd  recommend to also wait until the developers support other gamemodes and their community.

One of my favorite games! It has such well made core mechanics that the game really doesn't get boring, IF IF IF IF you are willing to learn the game itself and have an interest in games with a high skill ceiling. This game is a blast for those like us. It has a fun competitive scene with quite a few other players, and does have really great and well made team objective base content.

The only thing holding this product BACK is a lack of MORE CONTENT. The base content starts getting recycled after a few hours of playing. There just isn't enough at all.

Those of us who play for the high skill ceiling are just a small percentage of the player base and certainly I will never get bored of those high level competitive duels and the competitive nature of the core game, as long as there are players to play against simply due to the content of the game being player driven inside those competitive variables.

 But this is NOT enough to keep, I think, the majority of players intrigued or interested long term. There is so much potential in this game..... Just being wasted.

*** This game has two MAJOR FLAWS; Torn Banner *1* refuses to acknowledge mod support which would propel this game into stardom and *2* doesn't develop base content quickly enough or nearly ever to make it fun long term for anyone who isn't willing to put in hundreds of hours to join the competitive scene ***

Until Torn Banner stops acting like the "Insert name of powerful company who lost its edge because of stupid a** decision making and business planning" (Nokia, AOL, the list goes on) of this particular genre, this game will not see the success it could have.

Torn Banner has made a gem at its core. But a core isn't enough to keep everyone interested or having fun.

This all points to my overall reason why I lean towards a negative review. Don't get me wrong, I don't hate the game. I love the competitive scene and play quite a bit. The game just isn't what it could be, and is missing a shi* ton of content for 40$. It isn't worth purchasing at the moment. In my opinion - Unless you love learning mechanics of a new game and can see yourself investing hundreds of hours to really join the comp scene.

Just one Example of the oversight Torn Banner is totally missing - The boss style fights that occur near the end of a Team Objective - Could you imagine those being monsters? Could you imagine the absolutely insane things modders could come up with? Templars vs a god level boss? What the f*** are you doing, Torn? You've designed an amazing game, with game mechanics fun as hell, and then in so doing you have created for yourselves the "I found some minor success, and so we shall now try not to break what is working" successful product limiting syndrome box.

Mod support would take this game from 100-1000 really f***ing fast. Get with it, Torn Banner.

Or just hire a new team to do it yourselves.....

Personally Im not a huge fan of the gameplay changes from chivalry 1. Holding block, the utility of kick being split in half to allow for the jab mechanic which feels like it wasnt very thought out, a few unsavory balance elements that I wont go in detail on, etc. etc. But I have to also criticize the game objectively for a few reasons, the first of which is that the hit registration is dog shit, and im not the only one that feels it. I cant count how many times Ive been hit by someone AFTER my attack visibly connects but neither does damage or interrupts their attack, or maybe ill hit a teammate when the enemy should be hit first. Another thing is the initiative you gain after landing a hit just doesnt exist. This is a HUGE problem in my opinion because the tutorial in the game tells you that youre at an advantage on someone after landing a hit but again, I cant count how many times Ive taken a hit after trying to use this fabled "advantage". Ive also noticed when I party up with 1 other person and try to join the 3v3 queue there will be times where we get put in the game, but either one of or neither of us show up on the scoreboard so we cant play. It doesnt happen every match or every 2 matches but it happens enough to the point it gets frustrating, Especially when you can wait 5-10 minutes sometimes just to be put against the same team that destroyed you last game. This is something ive heard noone else talk about but im willing to bet im not the only one its happened to.

With all that being said, this game can be enjoyable. The epic battles across huge fields and massive castle towns is unmatched by any game out there (that ive played) so if thats something youre looking for above all else, then give this game a shot, But if youre like me and want a mixture of awesome medieval sword fights and sieges on top of some fun easy to learn hard to master type mechanics, Id personally point to Mordhau for this type of experience. (yes Im aware that game has its own problems but its my review and I vastly prefer that game)

Of all the combat elements within this game, nothing quite compares to the sheer blunt force trauma of getting bodied by a ballista bolt.

Kill archers. Behead archers. Roundhouse kick an archer into the spike trap. Slam dunk an archer baby into the pit. Crucify filthy archers. Pull out archer's tongues. Defecate in an archer's food. Launch archers into the sun. Stir fry archers in a wok. Toss archers into active volcanoes. Urinate into an archer's brazier. Judo throw archers into flame traps. Twist archers heads off. Report archers to the IRS. Karate chop archers in half. Torture archers. Trap archers in bear traps. Crush archers in gates. Liquefy archers in a vat of acid. Eat archers. Dissect archers. Exterminate archers in the gas chamber. Stomp archer skulls with steel greaves. Cremate archers in the oven. Lobotomize archers. Mandatory abortions for archers. Grind archer fetuses in the garbage disposal. Drown archers in fried chicken grease. Vaporize archers with a ray gun. Kick old archers down the stairs. Feed archers to alligators. Slice archers with a longsword.

Its all roses and daisies... 
- Beautiful Graphics 
- Great Music
- Great effects
- Very fun. 
- Welcome introduction of the chambering.

HOWEVER! 
- The held block system is a huge departure from the original Chivalry 1 gameplay. As a Chiv 1 player, i found myself very frustrated with features missing giving an edge against other players in pvp. 
- Cannot crouch dodge most side swipes, therefore the feature is gone, giving any GI joe a chance to win by design. This is a big NO. 
- Held block allows for gankers (* Many players to zerg rush you ) And you have little space to combat them by design, even with high skill level. Many nerfs on character movements, sword speeds, and slow windups dont allow you to fight a large group, evidently ending with your death. 
- Game appears to be designed to cater the maximum amount of people, rather than give breating space for players to develop interesting techniques. 

Unfortunately, i will have to not recommend the game. I am a Chiv 1 player, i was the best at most of the games. And i have been so through skill and technique ( even though with keyboard and mouse ). Through timing, feints, drags, and patience. 

This game however? ... too many crutches for the average nub, too many nerfs on quick weapons, Too many safeties such as held block. I am disapointed, and do not recommend it to chiv 1 players.

Edit: I still give this game a downvote. 
The held block feature acts as a crutch for new players. Giving little time for feints,
The windups are slow, and the combos are also slow. 
The crouch mechanic to dodge side swings is gone.
Little room for skill, and lots of room for mindless block and ganking.

After 45 hours of Team Objective and dueling (with a 50/50% split) these are the negatives i noticed, that ultimately made me not interested in the game anymore.

[h3]1)[/h3] Teammate indicators are tiny, easily blend in, and just disappear 5-10 meters away. That makes reading the battlefield unnecessary hard. 3rd person view helps but has a fixed narrow FOV that looks very bad.

[h3]2)[/h3] Big battles are rarely a line vs line, and more often dudes trying to run around and backstab as much as possible, or 2-3 players ganking on some dude that is separated from his team. This tactic or flow would be fine if it wasn't so much reinforced by movement mechanics and bad team indicators (1st point).
[h3]2b)[/h3] Movement mechanics problems are: very fast top speed (it builds up when holding W), and very slow low speed (first steps forward, or walking sideways/back). The battles look like everybody is a cavalry unit: they hit & run through, circle around to hit unsuspecting enemies. If you're in melee range, its very hard to disengage to seek your team, and there's also a catch up mechanic that gives speed boost to chasers. The incoming enemies with top speed will make sure you're gangbanged thoroughly, and you're entirely dependent on teammates either helping you or running off.

[h3]3)[/h3] Unoptimized controls. Can't bind "dash" to separate key (its merged with "jump"). 
Why when i press "Slash attack" two times in a quick succession, it doesn't do a "Slash" -> "feint into Alt Slash"? It should at least be a toggle-able setting. Its inconsistent, because pressing "Slash" then "Overhead" makes you feint without the need for Alt Attack Modifier. Same thing with countering, if i'm doing "Counter->feint into Counter" with the same attack type, just make me press the same attack type again (why do i need to use "Alt Attack Modifier"). For countering, at least i found a fix for this: bind both "Alt Attack Modifier" and "Parry" to RMB - that way you do first counter (alt modifier on), release RMB and can do a second counter just by pressing attack.

[h3]4)[/h3] HUD: no mod support to change it. Health and stamina are bottom left, too far from center of attention.

[h3]5)[/h3] Slow, muddy and clunky feel of combat. The thing i most hate is the mouse sensitivity limiter during attack release. I understand why limiter is there, but its just a band-aid fix, and there are other ways to achieve good looking combat.
Because of sensitivity limit, you kinda need a huge mousepad.
When i see a very slow attack / drag, that hits like a truck, it immediately breaks immersion. Someone gently touches me with a hammer or axe, and i lose half of my health. 
Feels like going into parry isn't instant, and there's a delay after you drop a parry, where you cant do anything and can still get hit or kicked to guardbreak (maybe the game isn't meant to be enjoyable for 50+ ping).

[h3]6)[/h3] Attacker advantage in TO. 
All map stages except the last one, are almost guaranteed to be lost by defenders => feels lame to even try to defend them, feels so artificial, like a sightseeing tour. 
On the other hand, playing attack is more fun cause you have more chance to wipe the opposition and push through like a hero.
Attacker team is often stacked by better players. Its obvious at first two stages when they will steamroll through the map. 

[h3]7)[/h3] No good training mode, bots are pointless, can't train certain mechanics or moves on your own. There's a tutorial, but it only serves as an introduction, weak one at that.
To get good you're reliant on dueling servers, playing against veterans that aren't there to teach you, and you have no replay function to see your mistakes.

[h3]8)[/h3] This style of ridiculous, weird and cranky medieval setting, is just not for me. The objectives, the narrator, the voicelines are very silly.

[h3]9)[/h3] Attack animations vary in quality wildly, somehow they can be both hard to read and ugly looking (sometimes its just the veterans manipulating the system with accels/drags).

[h3]10)[/h3] 3rd person vs 1st person dilemma.
In Team Battles, 3rd person view is way better, you get more results with it. But it also looks worse (FOV too narrow) and not as immersive (1st person animations are solid).
In 1st person, considering bad team indicators, sensitivity limiter during attacks, the need to aim when parrying, losing sight of the enemies if i'm doing an accel - means i just don't see what the hell is going on.
Someone in 3rd person just sees the battlefield much better, he can see what's happening behind the row of fighters in front of him, and directly to his sides - so all the mentioned problems in 1st person view have way less impact.

[h3]---[/h3]
Overall this game seems questionable to sink my time into, its a gamble whether or not higher skill will solve above issues. The game's style, design decisions and quality problems are reasons enough for me to drop it.

If you want a good swordfighting game, try Vermintide 2 on sale, it has something for any skill level, great teamplay and a smooth progression.

Almost 600 hours on this game and yes, I am giving it a negative review.  Why?  Because the game is INFESTED with cheaters.  One simple google search will show you how they do it.  They aren't genius hackers, they simply use a program that someone else wrote.. and guess what, it's free of charge to them.  I report cheaters OFTEN, at least 10 times per session, yet the developer does absolutely nothing about it.  I've emailed them repeatedly and the only email I ever got back was a confirmation to tell me they got my email.  I just wanted to know if they do anything about cheaters.  But, the proof is in the game- You can report someone until you're blue in the face, even start a different game, then see that same cheater the next time you're on.. and they'll still be cheating.  My guess is they don't care.  It's another player, right?  Maybe that gives them a lot of players for now- but with that model, you'll win the battle and never the war..  Maybe not today, maybe not next week, but people will move on.. you can only take so much.  

The main cheat you'll see is "speed-hacking." They'll pick a weapon with high damage and hack it to be a speed similar to a knife.. Who likes playing against someone who has a giant advantage?  So because I'm honest and have integrity (therefore I REFUSE to cheat), I have to put in twice as much effort to beat a cheater, while they effortlessly take first place and gain all of the benefits that come with it.  I've become good at this game, my rank is over 500 and I have 572 hours on it.  You can't stare at the same screen for 572 hours and not notice things that are out of place.  Sometimes you'll see a cheater FLYING around the place and killing everyone in seconds.  I emailed video proof even!  Yet I got crickets from the developer.  The developers DON"T CARE.

Updated 30/11/22: 
Still has a lot of bugs but they have been balancing the maps a bit.
Player count has also stabilized a bit, sometimes going up but it suffered a big drop before that.

It's....ok. Block doesn't work half the time (literally, you'll have 100% stamina and the weapon will sail right through your block), ranged weapons are laughably inaccurate and their ammo doesn't always register hits and/or teleports through people, games are usually VERY one sided and most fights are 1 v 7. It's VASTLY better than that toxic cesspool Morhau, though. However, just like Mordhau, it doesn't seem to have a functioning MM that's balanced. Yes, it's much more accessible than Modhau, but you'll still have match after match after match where you do more team damage than enemy damage and where you only get one or two kills but you die 20+ times. It's super fun when you can get fair fights, since you can't spin to win like every no lifer in Morhau, but as I said above, fights are rarely 1v1, or even 1v2. I wish I had a "meh" option, instead of just yay or nay. Since I don't, I have to go with No, since I'll probably only play it three or four times a year. It's just too chaotic and unbalanced to be fun. If you can, get it on heavy sale. It's no where near worth the full price.

TLDR: The gameplay is solid but multiple bad decisions or lack of decisions from the devs, including essentially supporting cheating.

The core gameplay is fun but the devs have made multiple bad decisions.

Team Objective game mode is inherently flawed with no signs of it getting fixed, The way it works is the attacking team needs to finish objectives to get to the next area of the map and the defenders need to prevent them from doing these tasks. Since people would not see much of the map if defenders were on equal footing from the start they "balanced" this by giving defenders significant disadvantages such as significantly longer respawn times and being spawned farther away from the objectives than attackers, defenders tend to get less rewards with more hassle.

The auto balance is bad, this means that players will almost always create an unfair advantage such as stacking all the skilled players on one team or having significantly more players on one team. The auto balance will move people if there is somewhere near four more people on one team than the other but its easy to avoid There is nothing preventing people from doing this.

Cheat prevention is non-existent, there is a report function in the game but all of these reports in regards to cheating are ultimately all ignored, there is cheating to the point of people having youtube channels dedicated to blatantly cheating on the game and they have never been punished. It feels like they are actively promoting the use of cheats more than preventing it.

It's WAY better than Mordhau. The attack keys are straight forward and easy to memorize compared to Mordhau. The classes are all easier to get to know and PVP feels smoother and more streamline. Not only is the PVP better and feels more legit. There are 100 different things to pick up or do in the game. The maps feel very evenly matched and it all together more fun. I have enjoyed myself so far. A troll here and there bragging when they are 600+ levels ahead is nothing when you can keep up with them when you know how to play. This game is fun. There's a couple bs things here and there, like catapult stones having the power of 5 pounds of C4 and killing 7 people at once. But it's not a big deal when you've played Mordhau and the PVP is so off balance where as here, as long as you are blocking and use your special and charges correctly, you can beat even high level players in a battle. That's how it should be. The sale price is gold for this game. It's just better designed than Mordhau. Try it out and tell me I'm wrong.

I marked this review as recommended, as honestly this game can be a TON of fun.  But the game has a lot of issues in meta, weapon balancing, and horribly jank animations for some weapons/manuevers (much less than Chiv 1, but still an issue).  Luckily the party functionality finally works (only took them over a year...).  That said the #1 problem the game has is team balancing, or really the complete lack thereof.  The game sorta kinda thinks about balancing teams at the start of a match (even though the only metric it seems to be based on is "level" which is more a function of playtime than skill), but after that lets people put themselves on whichever team they want as long as there is space.  This leads to team stacking from experienced players onto (almost always) the attacking team so that they can win and get more kills, which has the side effect of making for frustrating gameplay for everyone else.

Recommended if you just want to mess around (though I suggest disabling chat because it can be SUPER toxic/racist/etc), and more so if you have people to play with, but there are a lot of issues to be aware of.

Do NOT buy if things like balance matter to you in games.

*At the start of every match you know whether you are going too win or lose based on your map and whether youre attacking or defending with a pretty high level of accuracy. Defense is fucked the majority of the time and on some maps its almost impossible to compete. 
*There are no elos or kds to split higher skill players evenly across teams so super teams are fairly common
*if youre on the winning team and doing well theres a good chance that you may be auto balanced from the winning team and basically forced to take a loss at the end of a game
*Players crank their mouse DPI so high they may spin completely before completing a swing of their weapons.

 If the things listed above wont piss you off too much the game is a blast. combat is fun and every weapon is completely different. text chat is vile and also hilarious. 

there are sooo many easy fixes that could be done to fix balance and improve gameplay on maps its almost comical. 

1 offense tends to have WAAAAAAY too much time to attack for each stage.
2 put a simple ticket/spawn count system like sooo many other competitive games for the offense.
3 put a max possible rotation for players when swinging their weapons (might already be a thing i play on controller now). ive seen players rotate like 720 degrees before swinging which is absolutely ridiculous.
4 archers either have to have a max spawn per match or stage or their arrows should only work on classes that have less visible armor. 
5 there needs to be more tight corridors or choke points so that defense has spaces that they actually can feasibly fight to protect.
6 every stage that is outside but players are to light things on fire needs to be redone. they are almost never competitive in the slightest.
7 for the love of god stop letting catapults be able to destroy every objective from 5000 meters away where defense has NO chance of stopping them.
8 Engineers NEED to get points for each barricade destroyed, there needs to be more incentives for them to be bothered with in objective game modes and there just isnt.

Im not particularly good at writing reviews so ill keep this short and sweet while bringing attention to the traits that most other Medieval Slasher games struggle with. Chivalry 2 is a fun medieval game that whilst not offering the customisation and freedom Mordhau does, what it does do right is fights that look like real fights and the gameplay while lacking slightly less depth than mordhau, is significantly less prone to animation abuse and the game is just overall much more intuitive. 

Where Chivalry greatly excels over Mordhau is maps and its onboarding for new players, while new players can still be mopped up by veterans, a veteran will use kicks, bashes, feints and dodges to beat a new player, while a Mordhau veteran can simply break the animations to excel or drag until your parry runs out. Did I enjoy Mordhau sales and absolutely cleaning up on the newbies? Of course I did but I think Chivalry has finally solved the "fights that look like real fights" issue and all it took was allowing players to hold a block.

probably only fun 1/10 times. 

of course they added battlepass stuff (if that's your thing, cool). there is no real restrictions on teamswitching, so those other 9/10 times the level 1000 players all just stack on one team for an easy steamroll win. yesterday the game only had 1800 players online (at least on steam) at what i would think would be peak time in my region so i wouldnt really say it's dead, just getting there since it can take 5 minutes to find a match sometimes. as with any game like this, ganking is the only real strategy so prepare to die hundreds of times to a 5v1, but i guess im just whining and complaining about that because i've been told to just go play a duel server. still very frustrating. finally, the game just feels kind of abandoned to be honest. the only thing i can distinctly remember being added post launch is the tenosia faction and multiple people in the discussions here on steam have said that over the course of 2023, there was only one "content" update. maybe its because i play the 40v40 stuff, but it feels like there's not enough maps and just in one 1-hour game session i end up playing the same rotation at least three times

edit: as of today, 03.02.24, i am unable to access the game. "login error: request timeout or null response". seems the developers have seen my negative review criticising the way they handle the game and have banned me. all jokes aside, how could i possibly recommend a game you cant even access after purchase? i've seen several posts saying this error is usually caused by server overloading, but if that's the case that speaks volumes as there's only 2000 players online on steam. even ubisoft has better servers

I'm writing this review to journal my experience with both Chiv 2 and Mordhau (apologys for the bad english)
Chivarly 2 is a larger game and you won't have trouble finding a server, a added bonus is that most servers will be mostly full at all times.  The Graphics are great even for medium computer like mine (Looks terrible on low settings) and the core of the combat is wonderful, I really liked Mordhau's combat system but i find my self like the core and i specify core combat more appealing given its ease. I appreciate the level of detailing that went into the map design as every map has a sense of awe about it.

This is all the positive things i can say for chiv 2 and here are the negatives (in my opinion)

1: Customisation is lacking at best, Mordhau has an extensive array of armor to the point that everyone in a server looks different, you can change the colour, the material even the foot piece and gauntlets can be changed. Chiv is different there is very little in the way of significant changes to overall look and the majority of cosmetics are minor altercations to the armour you start with.

2: The actual combat in chiv 2 except for dueling servers boils down to ganging up or being ganged up on by 6 other players. Also the hit boxes are atleast from my experience worse in chiv than Mordhau, so many times have i been killed despite looking at the direction of the attack and even more times i have been killed because despite attacking a while before the enemy the attack is negated and i die.

3. Community is not as appealing, I mean this is just my opinion but i prefer the mordhau community

I would say if you want a "easier" learning experience play chiv
if you want better graphics play chiv
if you want epic castles play chiv
if you want a challenging learning curve play mordhau
if you want more customization play mordhau
If you want more realism play mordhau
if you like horde modes play mordhau

If you have the capacity to prevent yourself from getting salty, the game is a blast.

If you live in the SEA region, DO NOT even consider buying this game. 
The SEA players are allocated to asia-east(low ping) and japan(high ping) servers 
but we get allocated into japan servers way more often that asia-east servers. 

This means that we need to keep on leaving and rejoining until an asia-east server appears. 
This is because this game, for some reason, does not have a region selector. Players have been asking for this for many years, but the devs don't give a damn about player experience. 

On top of this, the asia-east servers regularly break. For days, even weeks, some players can experience abnormally high ping in asia-east servers while their connection in the custom servers (HK, SG) still work well. This is happening to me currently for the second time, and it's the third day at this point. The last time it happened to me was about a month ago, which is why I quit the game for a while. 

A PvP-focused game like this having servers like this is an immense problem. The fact that the devs have been completely ignoring this problem doesn't bode well either. 
So please don't buy this terrible game that ignores players who can't play the game because of janky servers. They deserve no support. 



If you're in the NA or EU region where the game's servers are somewhat functional.....
I still do not recommend this game. 

All the animations have way too much overswing.
A longsword looks feels like it has the weight of a tire, and the combat is extremely gimmicky overall with a high skill curve relying exclusively on gimmicks that function like coin tosses thanks to the game's pathetic hit registration.
This makes the combat feel extremely clunky and unsatisfying.

Furthermore, the small yet old playerbase is full of people who played this game a tad bit too much for their own good. Since there is no skill based matchmaking (I don't think there should be one in this game since the playerbase is too small for it), noobs are placed amongst people who have put thousands of hours into this game. Combined with the gimmicky combat, the new player experience can be described as 'atrocious'. 

It is also quite evident that the developers of the game know very little about the weapons used during the medieval era, displayed by the presence of weapons such as:
The DOUBLE HEADED AXES (no practical use, the few that were made were all for ornamental purposes)
The heavy cavalry sword (way past medieval era)
The Italian dueling rapier (also past the medieval era, should be changed to the sidesword or the estoc)
Messers that aren't actually messers (seriously?) 
The two handed hammer (never even existed) 
And weapons that look extremely heavy because they have too much metal on them, whether it be ridiculous langettes or metal shafts. 
It is also disturbing to watch small weapons like daggers being able to easily 'block' large weapons with ease.


Finally, the game should remove the team change feature. This causes massive imbalance in game lobbies and most of the matches I've been in were steamrolls. Since people like to play on the winning team, it often ends up with the very experienced players stacking on one team to curbstomp the noobs.
Instead, they should add a 'preferred faction' option, so that a player can still play on the faction they want to play in while not being able to change team. 

Player-to-dev communication is absolute garbage in this game. Servers aren't being fixed, important QoL changes aren't being implemented, and I don't think this is going to get better anytime soon..





For the past couple of weeks, I've been in contact with a game dev about the server issue. I've sent him lots of server performance reports, hoping that something could be done. The only solution I was given was to contact my internet provider.
This doesn't make any sense. All my other games run with single digit ping, every other server except the asia-east servers have ping I would expect them to. 
Every second I spent in this game was a terrible waste of my time, and I am uninstalling this pathetic excuse for a live service game. 
DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE

Thrusts players into an adrenaline-fueled medieval battlefield, delivering an unmatched experience in sword-swinging chaos. The game's fluid combat system makes every clash feel intense and satisfying, with large-scale battles that are nothing short of epic. From sieges to duels, Chivalry 2 nails the medieval atmosphere with impressive graphics and immersive sound design. With a variety of classes, weapons, and a fantastic multiplayer experience, it's a game that effortlessly balances mayhem and strategy. Prepare for a knightly adventure like no other – Chivalry 2 is a triumph in the realm of melee combat gaming!

This is the perfect game for me. I have reason to suspect the developers have been stalking me since I was a youth collecting data on what I would enjoy in a game. This game brings me back to my childhood adoration of siege engines, knights, and medieval weaponry. It's immersive, detailed, and addicting. The combat system is simple, yet has a high skill ceiling. The sound-design, voice acting, and soundtrack are top notch. When the match nears it's conclusion the music kicks into high gear and just feels cathartic. And last but certainly not least, this game is funny. Even now with hundreds of hours in this game I still find myself in new situations worthy of laughing about. Such as being killed by a giant fish, or a one-armed man with a flaming chicken.

In summation, this is my favorite game. I don't know why I hadn't written a review until now. Because it certainly deserves a positive one from me.

Picked up the game on the winter sale, since then im having a lot of fun. 

With the time though I have noticed something very unpleasant, not that big of a deal not to recommend the game, but a big con to have in mind. 

There are the so called team switchers, and the devs will probably never do anything about it. But almost always the attackers' team gets filled with higher level players. They usually do that so the games last longer, but what happens is they most of the time turn into a stomp. It's not a fun experience for newer players on the defending team, but its also not fun for everyone (exept the top 5 players) in the attackers' team. Honestly IDK how it is even fun for the top players...

Occasionally you'll get that balanced, epic and very close game. But it's quite rare, most games are stomp/wins for attackers. 

The game still is very fun, there are duel servers, free for all servers etc. Where this does apply so yeah. Give it a try, don't even wait for a sale, Its insanely fun, easy to learn, hard to master slasher.

If you remember and loved Chivalry stay far away from Chivalry 2

Chivalry 2 simply isn't Chivalry.  By that I mean it lost its identity and is now just another PvP game.  I immediately noticed the number of work arounds and counters tripled or more.  If memory serves me right in Chivalry 1 attacking drained your stamina not blocking this was switched and I would say for the worse.  Parrying is now an option and if you can parry you can near always win and this leaves your opponent disadvantaged constantly (I know I can't parry so this is a me issue) but it takes away the defenders stamina while keeping yours regenerated for parrying.  Parrying biases aside it doesn't matter if you're good at this game or not cause if you're in a duel usually 3 to 4 people will come over from either team and finish you for an easy kill.  Another work around that kills the fun of Chivalry's combat is it's whoever can get to the edge of your character first usually wins.  I'd bring up the archers but I'd rant instead of review. 

So what is Chivalry 2 honestly I'd have to call it Medieval Battlefield 4 no one really cares about the objective or winning.  I understand to some people that sounds awesome and I can understand that I really didn't have any gripes until my final 3 hours.  However that's not what I came for I came for Chivalry with improved graphics, new weapons, bigger and better maps, better customization.  I'd say I got everything except Chivalry 1 2.0. 

Side note if you war cry 8/10 times your characters voice cracks and I just don't enjoy playing as a prepubescent teenage boy.

The game is EXTREMELY fun. I, personally, had a lot of moments of pure joy from interacting with others and seeing with what shenanigans I can get away with. There’re however some outstanding problems, that I believe new players should be aware of.

I will explain the problematic mechanics first before critizing the game.

The combat is timing based, meaning that each attack and each block take up the window of opportunity that your opponent gets or loses, based on your split second decision (in game it is better described as the “initiative”). There’re also jabs and kicks, which stagger the attacking or blocking opponents respectively, making it possible to dictate the rhythm of a fight. The mechanics not only reward patience and game sense in both 1v1 and 1vX situations, but also help to create a chaotic atmosphere of a medieval warfare. The combat is semi-directional, meaning that it DOES matter which way you face your opponent in order to successfully block or land a hit, but it’s not something like, for instance “War of the Roses” did. 

The review is  NEGATIVE, however, due to how the game is currently balanced around player rank and weapons.

Probably the most notable is the balancing issue. The game suffers heavily from teamstacking. Your general Chivalry 2 round will look something like this: the round enters preparation phase, players join and some IMMIDIETLY switch to spectator (mostly high ranked and experienced players). When the lobby is mostly filled, they then join the side that has the highest ranking teammates. As you can probably guess, the game ends with one team almost completely domination the other. There doesn’t seem to be any kind of auto-balance measure either, since quite often teams are unevenly matched. Granted, this doesn’t always happen and some games end up even both in numbers and ranks. This means, however, that Chiv2 lacks any kind of level balancing to prevent this from happening. Because of this, some rounds are completely one sided in spite of the level and objective designs being built around specifically to counter that.

The weapons are divided into one handed and two handed with each class having access to certain loadout combinations and unique skills, only they can use. Each weapon has their respective wind-up time and the release time after which comes the hit. Two handed are (obviously) MUCH slower than one handed, which is compensated by them having greater reach. And, like previously mentioned, since the combat is balanced around timing and reaction, the lobbies are dominated by high ranks using faster one handed weapons like morning stars and warhammers with shields (Edit: which also gain bonus damage when striking with overhead), and ambusher class, which has extremely high attack speed and one hit-kill with throwing knifes. With this meta, two handed weapons are mostly viable ONLY against crowds and [strike] practically unusable [/strike] (Edit) puts you at disadvantage when facing experienced opponent with a knife or star in a 1v1. This wouldn’t have been such an issue, if it wasn’t for the fact, that most one handed weapons have the same if not higher damage than two handed weapons. When taking the balancing issue into consideration, we get lobbies full of 500+ lvl players running around, seeking low-level opponents, switching teams to keep their score and K/D high, while also punishing with frequent jabs and kicks.

This is made worse by how the game treats riposte and counter. Both grant active block (0.5 and 0.4 seconds respectively), which prevents incoming hits and reduces your attack wind up time (which I don’t believe game ever specified). This is however, extremely inconsistent due to either latency, poor hitreg and two handed weapons’ being so slow to swing anyway.

The issues are manageable, meaning that with enough time investment, you will learn how to handle different weapons, when and how to utilize different mechanics available to turn the tide of a fight into your favour. But in order to achieve that, one must go through many rounds of unfair staking, uneven fights and frustratingly inconsistent hit registration to “git gud” in a casual game.

Nevertheless the game is worth playing regardless: there’re many things like interactive level design, fun mission objectives and addicting combat to just give it all up. However, facing opponents may end up being the highlight or the lowest point of the match for you. The game suffers from inconsistences issue, while demanding attention and timing in combat.

Edit: Spaces and wording.

Edit2: Having written this review and after playing some more rounds, I've came to realise that, more ofthen than not,the combat can be very hard to enjoy. On top of the problems I've mentioned before, here are some more that stood out to me: any sense of pace is gone due to how weapons are balanced, jab and kick are practically gamble (don't always connect, different classes with different weapons have varied stagger duration), active block doesn't work sometimes, the game promoting toxic team play behaviours by passively encouraging ganging and mindless spamming, which results in team damage and/or TKs; swings, stabs, overheads are practically indistinguishable in their animations (which is made worse with stabbing only weapons and being able to feint into the same attack types), first person is nigh unplayable regardless of the FOV settings...

In this review I've tried to avoid the topic of cheating since, judging from my personal experience, I've never encountered any blatant cheating. But (and it's a big BUT): the game uses "EASY ANTICHEAT!!!" which is just plain unreliable.

If you want to buy this game for some casual fun: I suggest against it due to how often you'll be staring at the respawn camera wondering "how did that get me?" or "what did I do wrong?" without actually learning anything from the encounter.
If you're looking for a competitive gameplay: I suggest against it, since for the game that is supposed to be based around tight timing and precision, there're too much "random factor" in the core mechanics.

TL;DR: The game has strong core and gameplay loop that is addicting and fun to engage with, but unfortunately it suffers from some inconsistent game mechanics based around timing and dodgy hitreg, while also demanding extreme precision. As of now, in order to have fun in MP, one must overcome high ranked players targeting the low ranks and plaguing the training mode, and teamstacking.

I hope that this review was helpful in some way, especially for those who feel the same about the gameplay or is looking to buying it, wanting to know what to expect from it.

Final edit: Grammer, wording, removed bits of unnecessary rant, moved TL:DR closser to the bottom.

[h1] Mostly a Good Waste of Time [/h1]

[h2] tl;dr [/h2]
Game has stability issues including framerate drops and freezing. Playerbase is strong but toxic, won't play objectives in team game modes, and team stacking is still an issue that takes away any fun in the game. I only recommend Chivalry 2 if you turn your brain off and play like a zombie swinging a sword. Otherwise, if you are looking for a team-based medieval slasher, Chivalry 2 will only satisfy that thirst during a minuscule of time spent on it. This game is mostly a massive waste of time.

[h2] Overall Review[/h2]
Chivalry 2 is sometimes incredibly addicting, with teams working together toward objectives and the attacks/blocks appear to register accurately. However, it feels that lately the quality has gone down a lot. The game still suffers from server issues where I'll be disconnected randomly or I'll experience frame rate drops and sometimes temporary game freeze. For a game that's been out for years, I'd expect better performance at this point. The game also has pretty bad landscape design. Minor props that you would expect the player character to walk over instead just stops moving immediately, sometimes leading to getting killed. It's incredibly frustrating to being in a fast pace fight only to have your character stop all of the sudden because a small box is randomly placed in the fighting area. Each player model has what appears to be 3 foot long bubble, which makes group fights absolute hell since everyone is just constantly blocking each other. I can't recall the amount of times I was screwed because a player just stood there blocking my dodge from an attack. If you turn off your brain and just swing, the game can be pretty fun. However, if you are more analytical, you can't unsee the flaws in this game and that will certainly affect your satisfaction.

Also, the community has become much more toxic. It's not uncommon to find the chat being filled with slurs and people talking about conspiracy theories. The vote kick system is pretty flawed since it requires over half the players to vote yes to succeed when most players don't even vote. There aren't any admins on the server, so you're pretty much stuck with what's there. In terms of gameplay, if I jump on a catapult/ballista that someone else wants to jump on, instead of asking or just moving on they will just start to attack me to team kill me. I'll start a vote kick and sometimes they get kicked. Most offenders don't get kicked since, again, the voting system in the game is cranked and that player will continue to be a nuisance.

I have also noticed that less players are playing the objective. I love team-based games where teams have to overcome objectives to win. That usually requires people actively working together and thinking about the next step. With this game being team oriented unless you play duel or FFA, there are objectives to win or lose. In my experience, most players don't even try to play the objectives. Most will just 1v1 in large groups without ever being close to the objective. I'll never understand why players won't go to other game modes if they won't play as a team.

Teamstacking is probably the worst part of the game. Some players may say that teams don't matter, but try playing this game when the other team has the most experienced players in the game. The game just becomes a steamroll fest, whether you play the objective or not and is ridiculously unfun. Most servers have this problem, with better ranked players flocking to the other team to steam roll, while the original team is stuck with noobs and casuals who eventually leave to find other servers. When I notice team stacking I immediately leave because I know I won't have fun. If I join a separate server I am greeted with the same exact problem. It amazes me that the developers have been completely silent about this issue. This is the final straw for me since it makes the game completely unplayable.

This game is fun and ridiculous at the same time. It takes time and patience to learn the mechanics, and the initial stages of progressing are actually fun. However, after a couple hundred hours and at a rank of 123, I don't find myself enjoying this game anymore. A lot of the gameplay is wasted finding a server that was not teamstacked as well as not full of toxic nerds, and when I find the one good match I keep playing only to go on the search for that desired good match again.
There is no room for skill when you are being killed by 3+ people, you will have no fun and you will quit in 30 days very forgettable bad fighting mechanics not fun at all.

"Easy to pick up, hard to master."

I put in some healthy 400+ hours into Chivalry, Mordhau, and now Chivalry 2-- I play Team Objective because it's what I enjoy. Duel and FFA servers are not my flavor. I like my slashers goofy at times-- I think C2 and Mordhau allowed for that. I believe that people who clamor for removal of "for fun" game play items, should stick to the duel or modified community servers.

Chivalry 2 has vastly improved the system in its predecessor Chivalry Medieval Warfare. Wide arc swings with polearms are viable but there are no more "helicopter attacks" while aiming at the sky and twirling like a figure skater. 

Comparing to Mordhau, the combat system is more simplified which is a genuine blessing. The frames in which you can block/parry are longer and combat in C2 relies more on positioning, strategy, and speed. I felt as though Mordhau suffered from LMB spamming with Executioners' Sword. To sum up C2 combat, you can:
- Fast Attack- Swing, Overhead, or Thrust
- Heavy Attack- Swing, Overhead, or Thrust
- Alternate Swing (Change direction of swing)
- Special Attack (Weapon Specific)
- Sprint Attack
- Kick
- Jab
- Attacks can be canceled for a feint.
- Feints can be morphed into a different attack type.
- Blocks can held but drain stamina. Kicks stagger blocking opponents.
- A riposte is performed by attacking quickly after a successful block. This will create a 0.5 second autoparry window that blocks incoming attacks in front of the player while performing the attack. This allows players to fight multiple opponents if they can riposte or counter the first incoming attack. This does nothing for players who are surrounded-- positioning is key.
- Counters can be performed by matching an incoming attack while blocking it. A counter negates stamina use of the block and also create a 0.5 second period of autoparry that negates stamina use (unlike the riposte). This 0.5 second period window can be extended by blocking any additional attacks and allow for consecutive counters. The follow-up attack after a counter is accelerated. It can also be feinted/morphed.

Game runs with no performance loss on an RTX 3060. Some levels have a greater resource need. Update your drivers and/or turn down your settings.

Chivalry II has consistently been my favorite game throughout this year. While the fighting system can be difficult to get used to, I find that it is intuitive after a bit of practice. There are 4 fighter classes to choose from, each with a few weapons only found within that class, as well as weapons that are shared across classes. This allows players to find the fighting class that works best for their skills and preferences. The melee attacks have an interesting flow, with a wide swing, a downward swing, and a stab motion, as well as a heavy attack and pommel strikes. 
The game has multiple maps that are well made and have details that the average player may not care about, but makes the game charming, for what it is. There is also an immense catalog for weapon skins, character skins, heraldry, armor, and more. Most skins come with leveling up, so the serotonin from getting gifts continues throughout playing the game.
Lately there has been lagging issues, which is making game play more annoying, so hopefully they fix that soon. There can also be problems with players being hateful and aggressive, but the community is typically pretty good at telling the offenders that they are not welcome. I have found many more friends during battles than foes, and as long as devs keep weeding out the problem players, this Chivalry II will stay in my Top 5 list.

If I can sum up my review of this game in one word it would be this one: neglect. 

When Chivalry 1 came out I remember playing it and having a lot of fun with what essentially is a medieval call of duty that required more skill than just point click and swinging you're weapon. It was by no means perfect and it had some flaws but overall it was a fun experience. When I saw they we're making a Chivalry 2 I was excited to buy it to relive that experience again but in a sequel fashion. But after my many playthroughs I sadly can't call it anything but a disappointment. This is not to say that Chivalry 2, on it's own, is a bad game. I actually played it for well over 200+ hours and had a lot of fun. However, the review question specifically asks me whether or not I would recommend it to other players. Sadly, unless you are a huge Chivalry fan, I cannot. 

As mentioned before the keyword is 'neglect'. It's what happens when you make a great videogame but fail to keep it up in an orderly fashion to avoid it falling off the cliff. While I understand the developers are very short staffed there are still many flaws that have absolutely no excuses or should have been fixed a much before they were. Team balance is broken. Certain maps double you're respawn time. Many of these issues have yet to be fixed and the only thing the developers have done is one new update that seemed to create even more issues than it fixed. As for the next update? It was supposed to come out in August and now it's been delayed to October. Because of the lack of new content, bug fixes, and updates the player numbers started to drop. As a result, the only people left are those who are highly skilled. Once you reach this stage it is nearly impossible to come back from it unless you have a lot to offer in return and these developers sadly do not. Perhaps their expectation was that the hype would last long enough that they could take major breaks between adding new content but that backfired completely. After you play the game long enough you begin to notice the issues that were once barely noticeable because you've basically experienced all stuff it has to offer. 

The overall point is that when you make a good game of this scale you can't just abandon it and hope people will stick around without asking questions. Torn Banner sadly became developer equivalent to the Dad who went out for milk one night and never returned home. The lack of new content, lack of updates, existing bugs, and dwindling player numbers do not paint a good future for Chivalry 2 and for that reason I can't recommend buying it right now. Hopefully one day the developers will prove me wrong. That being said, if you really love Chivalry or still want to buy it anyway wait for it to go on sale. Do NOT buy it at full price. 

I give this game a 2/5.

*REVIEW UPDATE AS OF 11/25/2023*

After having uninstalled the game the developers finally released the new "Reclamation" update in November; nearly two and a half months after it was supposed to come out. To give a fair shake I decided to reinstall it and see if this update was any good or if there were any improvements. The update itself is lackluster to say the least. The new weapon, the siege crossbow, serves a very limit purpose and overall kinda sucks. As for the map, it is much better compared to the last one and is actually fun to play but is incredibly slanted towards offense. Also, the new map is not in the regular map rotation so the only way to play it is in a public 40 player server list and hope you get lucky running into it. Absolutely NOBODY plays these gamemodes at the main menu. The new gamemode "Last Peasant Standing" was something I was super excited for and yet it is nowhere to be found which is a HUGE letdown. Even after a huge delay the developers still managed to only put out the bare minimum. So my review has not changed. I still cannot recommend this game until the devs decide they actually decide to put in effort and make it better.

LIST OF EXISTING BUGS AND PROBLEMS THAT CONTRIBUTED TO THIS REVIEW
-Respawn time is doubled in certain gamemodes and maps for no reason at all
-Weapons on players and playermodels are sometimes invisible which cause confusion in combat
-The "desertion" mechanic is broken and punishes players who survive past the objective by forcing them to move and if they are not quick enough autokills them
-Horse mechanics are incredibly buggy; it is easy to get stuck and there are delays in movement it just simply isn't finished yet
-Newer maps such as Stronghold, Montcrux, and Bridgetown have serious performance issues causing frames to drop
-Matches end way too early when there is still objectively a chance that a team could clutch. If a minute is remaining the entire 60 seconds should play out instead of just ending abruptly at either the 50 second mark or 30 second mark because the match hasn't actually ended
No custom servers without having to do a demonic ritual in the year of our lord 2024 just absolutely ridiculous

Now THAT'S a fun multiplayer-only experience. Totally sold me with the free weekend and I'm continuing to have a blast with it. 

I've largely backed out of playing most multiplayer-only games at this point as I've personally found more satisfaction elsewhere, however, Chivalry 2 has rightly sold me on this one. I will hack, thrust, and slash my way through an entire late night and not even realize the time that has slipped by.

I've always heard the phrase "Don't be a hero" get thrown around in real life - cautioning others at the risk they may be putting themselves in. Not in Chivalry II lmao. This game brings out the hero in everyone. A whole team of Leeroy Jankins game after game and I wouldn't have it any other way! There’s never a dull moment, no matter your skill level.

One complaint I had with the original Chivalry was my inability to competently grasp the controls. That has not been the case here. Seems like they are more natural and flow well. Seems like whatever was needing tweaking has had the right touch! I do wish they'd ease up on the cosmetic store prices. Seems like a lot of in-game play to earn much currency. 

Come get bloody, gore-soaked, become an arrow-sponge, and have your head lopped off by a halberd. I highly recommend it all.

The developers are truly a master class on what not to do when your niche indie franchise grows to be successful. They're not happy with their huge sales and game pass deals, they've now turned the monetization F2P. Bugs that have been out since the epic launch and promised features are still not around. True cross play, non-glitched customization etc. 

This is a slap in the face to the kickstarter contributers that made this all possible.

On top of that, the weapon and class balance is terrible, Vanguard is the best by a mile and the other combat classes are just food to axes and mauls. I would not recommend giving these devs anymore money.

edit: cross progression removed from the docket. Play mordhau

Devs dont care about this game anymore. Not worth it anymore.
Some of the issues:
- hit registration is broken - basically you are playing lottery game, wondering if your or your enemies attacks are going to hit or not, 
- many weapons are broken/OP - for example: messer hit range is longer than its model 
- optimization is nowhere to be found (since last patch, on my potato pc i've been hitting 20-25 fps, before it was comfortably sitting in around 50)
- servers are crashing every day
- constant "lost connection to host", "lost connection to server" errors
- a lot of bugs spawning you under map, or not letting you spawn at all + last patch reintroduced bug that was fixed for sometime that spawns your character, but you are locked in free cam, with only fix to this is leaving server
- a lot of cheaters that are not getting banned at all
- match making is HORRIBLE, and high level players constantly abuse team switching, to get into better team, shitting on non existing balance even more
- there is absolutelly no balance on maps, you are either attacking, or you are getting fucked by attackers - attackers have faster spawns, better placement of said spawns, easier objectives (some of those defending team never wins) etc. only thing that defenders have is - on some maps last objective can sometimes be won if you have a good player at top spot
- last 2 points are making 90%-95% rounds, one team (mostly attack) completelly dominating the game
- a lot of toxic players (and i mean ALOT), and the only thing you can do is mute them for ONE! round
- new patches breaking things that was working (example - gate on rudhelm not opening any more)

In conclusion, it is really sad and frustrating to see this once fun and exciting game to play, in this sorry state, abandoned by devs.

Fun game for a little bit. You can see why the player base will continue to shrink though. The player base is so low that matchmaking is broken in the sense that you will be under level 50 and be matched against level 1000s and such throughout the 64/40 man matchups. I get you can be as good at any level once you unlocked all your weapons/classes, but matching against people that have thousands of hours when you have less than 10 will make new players quit the game early on. I mean, look at activity over the past year. The player base dropped to nearly 2k, game goes on sale tripling the player base, and less than a month later we are almost back down to 2k. meaning new players do not keep playing the game. Maybe a game mode that matched based off of level would alleviate some turnover.

Hackers are running rampant in this game and the devs have no intention of doing anything about it. Their anti-cheat is straight garbage. Anybody can just load up Cheat Engine and use the speedhack even if its just slight. 

I've never seen people swing the heaviest weapons imaginable in the game like they are toothpicks so much in my life. It definitely doesn't help how people who are outright worse than you are doing the most trash talk and there's no easy way to report them. Not like they'll get punished for it anyway. 

I've encountered a severe amount of one shot hacks being used as well. I'm running around as a Knight - the tankier class - getting one shot by a knife, sword or insta dying to fire pots while I'm at full health and the fire damage comes up as "4 damage". Implying I only had 4 HP at full health. Let's not forget, if you try calling out cheaters, you signed your own death warrant with everybody because they will immediately dogpile on you in chat and votekick spam you. 

I've also encountered infinite health hacks being used by a lot of people as well as infinite stamina and infinite weapon durability. When you have one guy surrounded by 6 people wailing on them and not only are they not dying, but they're constantly blocking with their weapon, not even parrying or doing any kind of evading. Then they take a single swing start one shotting everybody.

I've encountered teleportation hacks that allow people to appear wherever they want, whenever they want. I had this happen in an AI match no less to end off a night of doing 64 man team objective. The game loves to respawn you half way across the planet, so it's incredibly unrealistic to compete objectives in some portions of maps. Me and 2 others noticed another player on the other team teleport into existence, conveniently in the exact spot needed to compete taking over a bridge and proceeded to clear 7 of us on the point like it was nothing. One shot, infinite stamina and health. 

I've encountered countless people that run through several oil pots and never ignite or lose health and they will even stand in the fire and take no damage and proceed to one shot your 130+ health class with a 70 damage non-heavy attack while you're at full health. 

I've encountered more people that phase through my maul swings. I see my maul physically go through someone's torso. Completely missing them and that same person one shots me with a dagger or a polearm while I'm at full health. People are hitting me through my block. People are 360 auto-blocking. I once had 6 people surrounding one guy and he was blocking everywhere around him and proceeded to start one shotting more than half the people in the group surrounding him before we managed to take him down with a lucky hit (or he turned the hacks off long enough to allow himself to die to try and make it look like he wasn't cheating). 

The devs care more about monetization than the game's playerbase and overall stability with bugs affecting crossbows, making it so you're incapable of aiming if you get attacked by a projectile at the same time as you're bringing your bow up, or people glitching into the geometry and spasing out, unable to move or defend themself and the game just outright spawning you inside of nothing and you're stuck in place until the game lets you suicide. Just to list a couple severe issues that prevent you from playing the game.

This is the second time in a row they took a game with huge potential and ruined it miserably with sheer neglect. It's absurd how little the devs care about this game. It's appalling. This game doesn't remotely deserve it's positive status. Steam reviews are a cancer. If something isn't reported on from a website or a YouTuber with a mass following, nothing gets done and games get reviews they don't deserve. 

They can't be bothered to fix their game and they can't be bothered to enforce anti cheat measures or reports and continue to cultivate one of the worst atmospheres in competitive gaming. Let alone the fact that people can straight up curse you out, sabotage you and your team, say racist things (except for the n word, because Torn Banner thinks there's only a single racist word in the world.) and overall, treat you in the worst ways that would make CoD MW2 Xbox lobbies blush. 

I witnessed someone on my team yell at everybody saying someone posted CP links in chat and then started a votekick against them, expecting to get them kicked then went into all chat telling people that the guy needs therapy. That person who got votekicked did no such thing. A retaliation votekick happened and there was a couple votes needed to kick the guy out. The fact you need a near unanimous agreement is a garbage feature. TB is protecting these kinds of people and letting them run rampant. Reporting them for their behavior doesn't work either. TB straight up doesn't care. It was on a 64 Team Objective lobby and the guy got over 20 yes votes to kick but 6 trolls in the team wanted to hit no to make the votekick fail.  

Any kind of call out for toxicity, cheating, hacking or criticism of the game is met with "git gud", "skill issue", "mad cuz bad" and whatever other variation of brain dead responses you can think of. Don't believe the "Very Positive" review score. The reviews are mostly made up of memes and people thumbs upping and saying one word or one sentence. This game is genuine trash and TB has lost all respect, credibility and doesn't deserve your time or money. They only care about battle passes and micro-transactions and people whose mentalities align with theirs. The reason they get away with this is because they have no real competition and what little competition they DO have is either shutting down or equally as garbage in quality and community.

I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

I really wanted to like this game. But I feel as if there was a lack of proper insight into what a fighting game should be. I won't draw comparisons to other games, but playing this I can't help but feel a lot of the combat was given severe oversight into how it should function. (I should note I have well over 1000+ hours in other slashers and melee-focused fighting games. Not that all games in the genre should be exactly the same nor play the same.)

The blocking mechanics feel so clunky more than half the time and hits feel more like a game of chance rather that proper mechanical application, I'm not super fond of the generalized block based on  your viewmodel nor the very strange parry system, I almost feel reflexive blocking would have fared better than something that's a generalized hitbox. The movement is strange and feels strange, especially the dodging aspect of things.  For a melee slasher, it feels as if the melee side of things was not properly thought out or planned and they settled for something more simple rather than tuning it properly.

Game was also only released because of Mordhau's bombing steam reviews, as if they'd somehow steal the playerbase from that small game to this (honestly) worse game than Mordhau. At least Mordhau has reflexive blocking and parrying that makes sense, this game has some of the worst combat logic and design I've seen in a game in a long time. 

I was excited for this game coming from other slasher prospects as I enjoyed the first all those years ago, but I can't quite recommend this one, it feels like it lacks a lot of love and a lot of proper critical thinking from a development point of view. The passion just isn't there, and for that reason, I can't quite recommend it to anyone who considers them self a fan of the genre as a whole.

[h1]The devs don't care[/h1]
and they continually prove as much with each successive (and delayed, literally 100% of the time) update.

Game has been out for almost 3 years and devs cannot figure out how to implement [b]basic matchmaking[/b] or team balancing, nor how to fix [b]persistent[/b] bugs (UI issues, inability to join friends, hit/block registers, etc). The only updates are battle passes to milk the player base, and low-quality, short maps that always bring a litany of new issues with release, such as the unwalkable terrain of the new map or the newly-broken objectives of old maps. 

There's no ability to host a game, and parties are arbitrarily limited to 4 despite there being absolutely [b]no mechanism for team balance[/b] in an online game, so regardless of who you do or don't play with you'll either be on a stacked team or playing against a stacked team each round. 

The game is on life support since new players wash out immediately upon finding a handful of these issues and [b]move on to a real game,[/b] and you'll continually see the same few dozen people playing in your region every time you decide to queue a match.

[spoiler]If you can get it for free or heavily discounted you may enjoy a few hours for the arcade slasher element, but do not expect any meaningful progression beyond somewhat flashier armor. The skill ceiling is high but you'll rarely get to see it since a brand new player and a maxed player have exactly the same matchmaking weight.[/spoiler]

good base combat system but there are a myriad of issues that make it purely not fun.

-All maps are attacker sided (by a large margin) causing mass team switching and no there is no effective auto balance system to fix this. Since I myself refuse to abuse the team swapping I find myself playing defence non stop because the attacking teams are always full.

-Game modes like team deathmatch are fun but you can't matchmake for such gamemodes outside of manual joining 3rd party servers, and I'm fairly sure third party servers cant host pure TDM even if they wanted to. 
Honestly some TDM servers would probably all I need to make this review positive.

-group matchmaking is general broken and a lacks basic features like leaving a server with your group.

-Everyone hates the ranged options, especially the siege weapons, no attempts have been made to fix or balance these.

In summary, the base combat system is fantastic and bog-standard team deathmatch is really fun, but everything else is broken and the developers seem completely deaf to the players wants and needs.

A short review for this game is that it's Team Fortress with swords instead of guns, but buggier. 

An excellent Medieval PvP game, in a number of ways poorly implemented for no reason.  Good feel for combat and movement, but hit boxes and basic commands can be a little goofy on busier days.  If smacking people with imaginary swords is where you're at, this is the game for you.

2/10 for mindless entertainment. 15/10 for hilarious if immature community (it is PvP, after all.)

Deep down, I've long wanted a game which just contained the Jedi Knight saber combat, just good simple melee combat which gets deeper if you want to explore. I want drop in and out games where I can hop in, kill some folk and hop out, Chiv2 absolutely delivers on this and is in my opinion the superior choice to Chiv1 or Mordhou, second only to War of the Roses which is dead now (God rest it's soul <draws cross on self>)

There's some areas to improve for sure...

- You can't just "join" your friends if they are mid-round, unless they've chosen a server from the browser
- Like any other game without matchmaking the round can snowball and you'll get steamrolled, or you'll be doing the steamrolling.
- Some maps specific objectives are designed.... poorly... either too easy, or too difficult to defend or attack.
- Respawn timer is obnoxiously long sometimes since you pop out in waves you'll miss the wave and be waiting for 12-15 seconds sometimes, and 1-2 other times.
- Respawn locations can be annoyingly far away... see poorly refined objectives.
- We really shouldn't be having skins that are difficult to identify, Yellow vs Red makes this even worse, as does being burnt or covered in blood - some skins seem intentionally designed to have as little colour on them as possible.

Yet in spite of all this every time I hop on I have fun, I learn a bit more and I have a good time, I'm not the best, but I hold my own and in a small group you can have an absolute impact on the dynamic of the game, especially if the rest of the server is sleeping on objectives.

This is the kind of game you want to convince your friends to buy and play with you. It is easy to start playing but has a high skill cap. The maps are interesting and add good variety. There are lots of class options and weapon selections that can fit any play style. I'll be able to play this game for days worth of hours.

The mechanics of the game are pretty solid in concept. the gameplay loop is good, it's fun and different enough to be playable for long stretches. my biggest issue with the game itself is you can't tell whos on who's team if the gore is on, everyone is just red all the time. if you disable gore it's better but it's a strategy to make yourself as hard to distinguish yourself from the enemy as possible as you get a LOT of sneak attacks because of it, and not in a fair or fun way. 

the reason I don't recommend this game is the community. every time the yellow team (some vague eastern culture) is the enemy the chat is "sand ni****s don't read! lets burn their stolen books!" or some other racist crap. it's incredibly toxic and you can turn off the text chat but it's a team game so that's not very beneficial for you to do. it's common place for players to go back and fourth calling each other names and being incredibly obnoxious and hostile. 

it's a fun game to play with friends and it's got interesting mechanics but if you interact with the community it's substantially more likely you'll be more frustrated than having fun.

Originally bought and played this on the PS5. I let go of my PS Plus membership over a year ago and was thinking about this game recently, then the free weekend and sale hit and it was good timing. Whether you're a duelist, a sweaty "take on all comers" warrior, a backhanded opportunist, or an archer in the back-line, there's a play style for everyone.
