Recently, I learned that you could play this game for free, for a few days, and it's also on sale. I enjoyed the first game and Chivalry 2 is even better. While I do like the game so far, it has some problems. I can't recommend it at full price. Buy only on sale. I'm also not sure for how long I will play it, because of these problems. 

[b]1[/b]. Players can switch between teams, in the middle of the match. It may sound rude, but there are real pieces of shit in this and many other online (especially PvP) games. It can get annoying soon. Some players just can't play without being carried by better players, and they lack decency to stay until the end. So while these degenerates get a free win, after changing team, the opposite team tries to avoid the inevitable. Of course there's also newbies and those who can't carry others, so the balance is not a thing. Note that this game doesn't even have ranks or anything competitive. Imagine what can kind of game this could have been, if ranks were at stake. At the moment, luck favors the coward.

[b]2[/b]. No connection filter/ping filter. I checked connection few times, every match. There were always at least a few people with close to 100 ping, often above 100, and even one guy with 220+ ping. You can say that in this chaotic mass genocidal game it’s not a big deal, but I will politely tell you to go fuck yourself. If the game has a really low number of players at the time we search for a match, then okay, I can live with 100+ ping players. On a regular basis? No, thanks.
Also, you can't check connection of other players or your own, other than ping. Even with good ping, players can lag etc. Either the data shown is fake, or server quality is below average.
Today I saw how few players just disappeared. I was fighting with one. They haven't DC.

[b]3[/b]. There are technical problems. When I changed an active character customization menu, the previous one haven't moved away. Two characters were standing on the same spot. "Texture clipping". I had a similar thing with weapon, in training mode. This time, my sword was in the air and not usable at all, while I had fists as active weapon... Imagine if it was a real online match.
Recently had a bug where I couldn't use/equip any weapon, after using horse.
Had server-side stutters/connection problems recently. I've seen players teleporting.
The game crashes with error, each time I quit it. Not a big deal, but it makes the game look like an EA/Indie game.

[b]4[/b]. There's one very low quality voice. It sounds like it was recorded with a cheap microphone, at home. I'm talking about one of the locked sounds. Not DLC or Northman.

[b]5[/b]. Customization is poor. 

I'm very sad. Faces are just presets, and there are only a few, not very attractive presets. The game is far from historical accuracy, so why make these faces?

Lacks of hairstyles.

Lack of facial hair, and you can change beard and mustache separately.

No face paint colors. I understand the armor color based on faction, but why force face paint color? 

Speaking of armor color. There are few armors without distinct blue/red color. It makes it harder sometimes to tell who is who.

Serious lack of customization options, and there's no shop for separate parts, like helmets and hair. Selling items is a good idea. It's an ethical way to get money. Players don't an advantage, as with XP boosters etc., and they know what they are buying (hello loot boxes).

With current DLC and updates, you can customize your character to not like a knight, but there's still lack of choices. No discrimination against knights, but since we have highlanders, horned black knight and now a Huscarl, why not introduce (fictional/popular design) the vikings, mongols etc.? This is what got me interested in the game For Honor. You could play as a fictional Viking, Samurai etc. The game was bad, but you got the idea.

[b]6[/b]. Maybe I'm a bit picky, but I'm not a fan of attacks based on how fast you can move your camera. It also looks silly. I saw a random video about another, similar game - Mordhau, where a guy moved like a damn spinner. Do you really want this type of game?

[b]7[/b]. Armor customization interface isn't the best.

[b]8[/b]. Too often, too many people just stand still, doing nothing. No auto-kicks or bans.


[h1]Final[/h1]

Buy on sale.

UPDATE 1: Changed review to negative. While I still enjoy playing the game, I'm not going to spread lies and BS. Reasons are below.

1) Poor quality of online matches. I mentioned it before. Players all around the world, with any kind of connection, can join your server, and you won't even know if they had bad connection, unless you obviously saw it. 

2) Progression is bad. I play normally, and receive cosmetics as rewards, but as I said before, customization is bad. There aren't many cosmetics to earn or ways to customize your character. Also, too high level requirement for some items. You will have a clone character.

3) Some classes have trash fixed loadouts. I remember that one good M&B Warband mod had equipment, which you could buy for money. You had to play better to get more money, and equipment was different for each class. In Chivalry 2 there are too many limits. I mean, how often will you use spikes? And that throwable toy for Vanguard? There are few others, much better options for class system/loadouts. I mentioned one.

4) King knows how many times I played with passive players. Literally each damn time I play the game, there are at least few players who don't do anything. They just sleep and give the other team free kills. Auto-kicks and permanent bans are necessary here.

With all respect, fuck the Tom Banner and his gang. Unless they fix these problems...

For a game that can be so fun the execution is terrible, loads of bugs and lack of quality of life features.
The most noticeable bug is game stuttering every minute or 2 for about a second (on a 4080) which often gets you killed mid fight. A common quality of life issue is if you load into a 3v3 arena during a match you will be in the game but stuck in a unskippable cutscene where you can be killed unable to defend yourself. There are many many more annoyances in the game which is a shame as the base gameplay can be very enjoyable if it works.

Three (3) things I would recommend: immersive medieval warfare, excellent role-playing story and characters, epic-battle mechanisms. Would definitely recommend for anyone interested in role-playing as valiant melee fighter, or perhaps a sneaky ranger. It's really up to you and your personal play-style.

Two (2) things I would suggest the developers to improve: new maps and new cosmetics. The game needs more maps, and the reason players all feel this way is because after around 60 hours players will literally have played all maps a couple times: and it feels kinda dull to have so few rotations! I also felt it takes too long for Torn-banner Studio to come up with new maps: the average time it takes for a new map to come out is about 5 months! The second suggestion about having more cosmetics is so obvious when you compare it with Mordhau: Mordhau has literally infinite combinations of cosmetics, whereas Chivalry 2 has way less options to choose from.

However, I still recommend this game because its flaws are so negligible compared with its core mechanisms! Go Chivalry2!

This game has some of the best, most skill based combat of any game that I have ever played. It's a total blast, and the weapons and classes offer a good bit of diversity of playstyles. Unfortunately, I cannot give this game a positive review, because nothing about it works. 

Due to the influx of new players from the game being put on PS+, the servers are completely overloaded all the time. At best, this is a mild annoyance. At worst, some of the weapons that require more precise aiming and timings are completely unplayable. You and your opponents will teleport around, strikes will faze through enemies multiple times per game, and sometimes a server will just time out and end the game. 

Assuming your game does function on a technical level, multiple main features of the game have been catastrophically broken by the latest update. The queue system for arena modes, which are some of the best modes in my opinion, is terrible. If you solo queue for arena 3v3, it will either 1) fail to connect you, resulting in you having to queue all over again, 2) connect you to a game that is LITERALLY already over, as in the win animation for the other team is playing by the time you load in, 3) should you be lucky enough to be playing with a friend, the game will place one of you into the game and force the other one into spectator mode or 4) connect you normally. This fourth option is, in my experience, a pretty low chance. 

An honorable mention for bugs plaguing the game is that pretty often upon joining a game, it will randomly change your equipped weapon/class. While not game breaking, it gets pretty annoying.

Despite the developers commitment to crossplay, allowing you to party and play with people on other platforms, the game lacks many key social features. There is no way to add friends from within the game, as even though the game gives you a friend code to share, it is regenerated every time you view it, making it impossible to send to people through the chat. Speaking of the chat, there is no way to party chat or message an individual person. There is no support for custom games, so to 1v1 a friend you have to connect to one of the (usually completely full) duels 1v1 servers, which are just free-for-all that relies on player etiquette to keep people sticking to respectful 1v1s. Usually, this would be moderated by a votekick system, in which people who interrupt others 1v1s can be removed from the server. Like many other things in this game, unfortunately the votekick system has been completely broken by the latest update and no longer works 90% of the time.

In my opinion, complaints about the games balance are overdone and frankly overstated. The games balance is pretty good, you can perform with just about any weapon, and there's a good variety of playstyles to master.

Should this litany of issues I have talked about (+ a good amount that I haven't) get fixed, Chivalry 2 would be one of my favorite games of all time, and I would be recommending it to anyone with a steam account. Unfortunately, in it's current state, my recommendation is to wait 6 months (or more) until the next update to see if they fix any of this before giving it a shot.

Easily the strongest medieval slasher currently active. Has plenty of weapons to master and fighting never gets old, once you've truly figured out what you're doing you feel unstoppable. Updates have huge room for improvement but the amount of free content they add is enough to keep me coming back every update.

And it's impossible not to mention the stunning models in this game, every armour piece, weapon and environment is beautiful.

Chivalry 2 is a medieval combat game with a good variety of weapons and 4 different classes that each have their own quirks. There is a pretty good variety of great TO (Team Objective) maps that all feel different each time you play them, they aren’t balanced that well but that doesn’t really matter that much, because it is a pretty casual game where losing isn’t that devastating.

Combat wise this game is absolutely amazing for someone who wants to play a medieval combat game that is easy to step into, it isn’t like MORDHAU where you are expected to put 100+ hours in to the game to be not completely trash (not necessarily a bad thing, just not something you want if you are looking for a more chill game). Like I said, there is a pretty good variety of weapons and most of them are viable.

The classes are also done pretty well, you have a classic knight class, archer class, vanguard (glass cannon) and the footman (in-between the knight and vanguard health and speed wise). Within those 4 classes you also have subclasses with different pros and cons.

The maps are great, even though they aren’t balanced all that well, it doesn’t really matter that much. Each objective is fun, the only complaint I have is that attacking is more fun than defending (some people switch teams so they are always on the attacking side, pretty annoying), but I don’t see how they can fix that.

The cosmetics are honestly pretty shite, there isn’t a lot of customization (way less than MORDHAU) and what is there is pretty meh (for armour and weapons).

**Currently there is a big issue where the game completely freezes for 1-2 seconds every match or so, that wasn’t an issue last year, unfortunately now it is an issue…**

Conclusion:
This is a great game if you are looking for an easy to step into medieval combat game with great gameplay. If you are looking for something more competitive/with a higher skill ceiling/higher skill floor, I would recommend MORDHAU.

the game is great atmospherically and is great for casual players, the held block helps weird wonky swing manipulation from being effective but the combat system is overinflated with additions that just complicate it for no reason (heavy attacks and jabs) and the attack animations compared to mordhau are much more wonky and ridged and some people have abused this by making certain swing types look like other swing types, making countering ineffective

it also doesnt help that 90% of the games combat boils down to mirror matches where you and your opponent just counter each other until one of you screws up

customization is also a big issue, unlike mord where you can customize anything about your loadout, from the chestplate to the shoes. chiv 2 is restricted to body armor sets and helmets and some of these sets look a bit tacky and stylized.

aside from cosmetic customization there is also barely any loadout/weapon customization, your given four classes and usually three subclasses that you can pick from, all with their own strengths and weaknesses and are restricted to their class weapons. so unique playing styles are completely out the window as you cant be creative with loadout customization, compare this to mordhau where play styles range from your usual heavy knight to a wannabe shaolin monk jumping and weaving through attacks.

and if your the type of guy who is frustrated and annoyed by ranged fighters in these types of games then you won't like the fact that two out of the three melee classes you can pick from have subclasses that have throwables and are pretty much played like pseudo-archers, staying in the back line and throwing throwing knives that deal an absurd amount of damage and unlike the dedicated archers, they can actually hold their own in melee.

chivalry 2 sets out to make the slasher genre more open to casual players and it achieves that but it's held back by its janky combat mechanics and lack of customization, as a person whose been playing mordhau casually on and off for a long time and have reached what is probably the zenith of casual skill in there, mordhau just seems more appealing.

however if your intimidated by mordhau then get this game, you'll have good fun.
but, mordhau. despite all of it's flaws has surprisingly less jank than this.

Title: A Triumph of Medieval Mayhem: Chivalry 2 Review

Chivalry 2 is an exhilarating journey back to the brutal and chaotic battlefields of medieval times. Developed by Torn Banner Studios, this long-awaited sequel successfully builds upon the foundations of its predecessor, delivering an immersive and visceral multiplayer experience that captures the essence of medieval warfare. With its impressive attention to detail, satisfying combat mechanics, and robust game modes, Chivalry 2 stands tall as a triumphant return to the age of chivalry.

One of the standout aspects of Chivalry 2 is its dedication to authenticity. From the meticulously designed maps that recreate medieval towns, castles, and fields of war, to the detailed armor and weaponry, the game transports players to a bygone era with stunning accuracy. The visuals are not only impressive but also contribute to the overall immersion, creating an atmosphere that truly feels like a battlefield ripped from the pages of history.

As a person with 500 something hours in Mordhau, I will say that this game is simply fun. Mordhau, the direct competitor, is not fun. Even dying in this game is more fun, and veteran players who have skill do not stomp as hard as they do in Mordhau because there are no excuses that promote the idea of a bad system being a good thing, since veterans can abuse it and no one else can. Now, this game certainly loses out in terms of customization, but at the same time I think that is one of the least important things, as having fun is more important, not to mention that the in-game economy is much better, and making gold is easier. It does have micro-transactions, but they are in no way important or gamebreaking, and are simply there to get more faster, just like all similar systems.

bad review will stay here until the sun is dead for 2 reasons. 
1: The game has been out for 1 year on epic game store. However hitboxes are complete BULLSHIT, catapult stones land on a different area from what you see (ex: the catapult fire was supposed to land at least 100 meters in front of me according to what i was seeing, it did, yet i died and the crater was created right on my body). Halberd is a complete joke, at least 180 degrees angle on the hit without the player turning the camera, short sword (and not just that one) are apparently as heavy as a two handed polehammer and swing as low no matter what the weapon stats say and the respawn system is a parody. There is even a map where you can respawn beneath the map and just fall and die. 15 of my team died that way at the same time. 
    Again. 1 year out.
2: Maybe they fix everything i mentioned above. Even if they do they will not fix the hilarious kick system. I was kicked twice in a day and lost around 1 hour of my life just because a snowflake was insulted when i said "this isn't a chatroom, shut up and play". Both times same reason. The votekick requires the majority of your team to pass. Unless they make it to request the majority OF THE SERVER this negative vote stays here to contribute to the negative percentage of reviews.
**EDIT**
Also the game says it has customization but that's a pile of bullshit. Your knight wears ONLY what he decides he wants to wear for the battle. You want to wear no helmet? Well bad luck, you are now forced to wear the ugliest most basic helmet because fuck you. Because we are the Chivalry franchise devs and can't even fix that bug, yet our modders make a much better game than ours called "Mordhau".
Achievements count only when they decide they want to count, there is one for 50 kills in a match, i get 50 kills every other match, yet nothing. It's still there to be unlocked. These people dared to rob 30 bucks for this shit.

*UPDATE*
Game is still a piece of shit. Hitboxes are still total crap, you see 360 swings everywhere, no turn cap, you just swing around and hit everyone like you're fcking Deadpool. People block hits coming from their back and even if you stand behind someone, his swing will hit you. That's how bad this game is. Seriously there ABSOLUTELY no reason to buy this piece of crap instead of Mordhau. It's AGES ahead. Player skill base is beneath the sewer, one faint or morph will confuse them and you can hit them. They just spam left and right click. That's it. Oh btw, you can block for like half an hour before you are out of stamina, but hey you can kick that person and the block breaks. With a rotation of several multistage maps, seamless arcade-like combat and a healthy player base of both new and experienced players alike, there isn't much more to be said about Chiv 2. For those tired of the typical point and shoot type combat games, this one is for you. The game includes unique weapons for each class, all of which can be suitable for any type of play style. You will constantly be engaged, be it rushing to the objective, fighting enemies, or just messing around with teammates with the variety of role play elements thrown in, it is impossible to play this game passively. Expect to be challenged, the learning curve is steep, but that makes it all the more fun. Words cannot do a game like this justice, the 64 player team based matches take what games like battlefield have and turn it to whole new extremes; Instead of being spread out, all players can converge on a single point, creating chaotic battles which, at times, can get your heart racing. I absolutely recommend this game anyone looking for a fresh take on multiplayer combat games, especially those who, like myself, are tired of the mundane and mind-numbing, 'point, shoot, move' format. I look forward to seeing more people enter this already prosperous community.

I've been playing this game for several months. I have read the reviews both positive and negative, and frankly, the negative reviews are nothing game breaking except for a few items I would agree with (hit boxes are garbage.) But overall it is fun. You should fully expect to be slaughtered by trying to 1v5. You should expect that someone else is better than you at ALL times. I love playing the game and I have always been very much against PvP games. Only a select few have EVER caught my interest in the entire 25 years I have been playing games.

I love medieval style combat systems and while I haven't played many of the PvP ones on the market, I can say that Chivalry 2 ranks on my highest list. 

The game really is all about "git gud" in your ability to play. I've used all classes and truly no one class is better than the other if you PLAY them. I've defeated shielded knights as an archer, I've stormed through vanguards as a footman. You just need to read the battlefield, know your strengths and weaknesses and it's a very fun game.

I'd rate the game a 9/10 ONLY because of a few issues with the maps being stacked very much against defenders.

A fine example of a game that is easy to learn and hard to master. Beginners start with a set of powerful weapons and classes. The grind is not a big deal. It is in contrast to many stupid time eating games not about outclassing other players. It's just for unlocking more diversity and features for posing. The challange is finding your weapon and class of choice and developing fighting techniques. Im fine with the content cos the maps will take you a while to fully understand. The random stuttering during the fist minutes of playing seems not to have been fully fixed with the latest patch. My simple workaround is playing a warmup offline.

the game is so much fun once you get a hang of controls, developers should add proximity voice chat then the game would be stupendously fun.
tip- guys having high ping issues, try selecting favourable server in standalone servers.

Well... I was going to recommend it since the game-play is quite a lot of fun, but the in-game shop click-scam is truly devious. Basically if you click on a particular item in the shop tab it just instantly charges you - there is no description of the item and no confirmation request of any kind! I lost £10 worth of crowns in an instant after clicking on winter war. Apparently it's a known issue, so I've submitted a support ticket, which remains unanswered after 24 days, with people active on the official discord suggesting that I might be waiting for quite a bit longer for a response.

So, in short: Fun game, but be wary of predatory in-game sales tactics.

the game is absolutely jank. horrible collision detection, insane amounts of crowding and teamkilling. It will take you 5-10 hours to get the combat, then you'll have a great time for about 20 more hours. Then the PTSD of the aforementioned problems starts to set in. And if you dont feel claustrophobic playing this game and walk away angry after playing it for a couple of hours, there is something wrong with you. Having said that, it is still good casual fun with friends. Would I recommend buying it? Not really. It exists in a semi-insulting state, but it is getting better. If you can snag a cheap key or something, it can offer about 20-30 hours of fun with friends. It's a solid IGN 7.

Go buy and play Mount and Blade I or II.  WAAAAAAYYYY better game in every way, including combat.

1. A guy with a massive 2 handed battle axe, can swing as fast, or faster than you with a knife/short sword, because of "reasons".  Never mind 2000 years of combat, and the game tutorial itself, that has taught a smaller weapon, can be welded faster and more precisely. But when in game, oh the guy parried you, making his massive 2 handed axe now as fast or faster than your knife which now takes longer to swing than his 2hnder.  Ya, I get they want to balance things out because then no one would play 2hnd battle axe, but thats ridiculous. They strive for combat "stages", which largely negate an advantage of weapon choice. 
 Gain some realism.  Sword and shield had been used for thousands of years... and these guys down play it to make this game stream lined.

2. Plus, allow people to choose their class instead of grinding thru the shit play.

3. I watched as one guy can sit in the middle of 5 guys, riposte one of them, then kill 4 of the attackers.  WTF is that bullshit.  Realism? Not even close.

4. Full plate armor means the attackers have to hit vital areas or tire the other guy out, not just swing once and BOOM, 3 guys are dead.

Summary: Realism is shit in weapons, armor, and combat itself.  All they want is a hack and slash game... Mount and blade is far superior.

I'm editing this to add that they had the resources to add a paid battle pass, but cannot fix bugs that should have been fixed before it came to Steam at all. 


I'm editing this AGAIN to tell you that the latest update has effectively destroyed the viability of one of the classes, the engineer. As an engineer you get access to barricades you used to be able to place strategically around an objective in order to slow the enemy down, but now this is made impossible. On Thayic Castle, the first objective could be defended by a single engineer if his team remembered to come beat the attackers off, now, you can't place anything near the shacks. You used to be able to make a little bunker for Argon II to hide behind from arrows and bolts, no more. Engineer was by far my favorite class to play, which now i probably won't even look at anymore because now it's just a class that takes more damage from 75% of the weapons in the game. Guess i'll just pick up a highland sword or dane axe and swing around from left to right with no regard for my team, like the most of the other players already do, amplified by the introduction of cross-play.

The most surprising thing? they actually made the game more newbie friendly this time with beginner (bot) servers in asia. back in Chivalry 1, they don't have that; you'd have to pick up the skill the hard way, or join the beginner servers in NA.

A good comparison would be that Mordhau is akin to a HEMA match, while chivalry is akin to a bar fight. both demand similar but very different and sometimes contradictory playstyles (eg: Chiv doesn't reward melee headshots beyond guaranteeing a kill with a beheading, while Mordhau rewards melee headshots with increased damage, sometimes to OHK levels)

Absolutely horrid, I have never ever had such a displeasure in my entire life towards any video Game and this one in specific takes the cake, Their Recent Update has made this game absolutely unplayable on Steam because you get a stutter no matter what you try via Graphical settings.

My True issues with this game.
Archers - The Archer class is fucking insulting and absolutely dog crap, Imagine in any game in history when you lead your shot with a bow would your arrow be able to hit its target if they are moving in only one direction? The realistic answer is Yes, Yes it absolutely would. In this game Chivalry 2 Arrows do nothing like this, the way it seems the devs have designed arrows and archers specifically makes it to where if your Crosshair isnt Directly on the person your shooting at it misses no matter what, and if your target is moving from left to right or right to left well your arrow will never hit because you cannot even lead your aim to have your arrow hit your target like in every single video game ever made up to 2023.

Class System - The Class system I assume has its reasons such as balance however is also absolutely garbage, The main issue is that the Class system has 2 Sub Classes per class, For Example Vanguard is the Main class and it gets two Sub-classes one specializes in CQC the other Specializes in dual wielding or something (I don't know because I don't play Vanguard). All Classes in the Game follow the same premise However in order to unlock that class you have to reach a specified level in order to pick one of the other two options for that Classes sub-Class Making all the stupid overpowered Meta weapons everyone and their grand parents used locked to new players who will constantly get stomped on in every fight due to this issue.

Customization - Absolutely a joke no effort was put into Customization you cannot even buy better weapons and use custom loadout's or kits that you make, The only customization is the Colors your wearing for each of the 3 Factions in the game, There is no Customization to the point where when a new player is playing this game for the first time, you get so little its sad and you cannot even try out any of the other Sub-Classes your just forced to use what the game gives you.

Team Stacking - Yeah this game has tons of it, if your Not on the Team with the Highest kills you basically lose every match and the Player to Player skill level is through the floor one team will end up with players who just got this on sale and  the other team will be level 400+ on the opposing team.

Graphics - I'll give the game this it looks pretty when you can stop and take in the view from time to time.

Maps - The Maps are massively unbalanced and favor one side or the other side heavily to the point where there's no reason to even try to stop the enemy team from completing the objectives because your just going to lose no matter what happens Unless you somehow end up pulling a hail marry then good luck.

Game Modes - Currently the game only has 5 game modes that you can choose from (this is not including those stupid limited timed event maps) This game's game modes are fun in concept but are unbalanced due to the map issues present in them, This game also has no PVE mode except for the Offline stuff which is boring quickly the Enemy Ai in this game are so brain dead stupid they just run directly to you and your other AI teammates (Sometimes) and even to the point where if your standing in a specific spot they will just commit suicide in a pond over and over just to reach you. So there is no Horde Mode then whats in this game? Well there is
  ->  Invasion and Team Death-match and that's it other than the Arena 1v1, 2v2 and 3v3 stuff but that's literally it other 
       than mounted warfare which lets you ride a horse and die constantly.

And that is basically everything in this game, Otherwise I can only say that my experience with this game has been horrible it has small glimmers of hope sometimes but otherwise I would not even recommend this game to anyone that I know at all due to the issues present in the game its just shit if you want a game that feels real and not some sick cash grab of a genre that Torn Banner abandoned a lifetime ago play Mordhau at least in that game you can have fun.

This entire review is coming from someone who has only 16 hours playing this game so far probably more later if they ever end up adding better modes to the game.

Chiv 2 is a pretty solid sword-fighting PVP game, and one I could easily recommend over Mordhau: the community is far more active, far less toxic, the combat is far harder to cheese, and it's currently in its prime having been out for about a year now. 

The combat is the big thing here so let's talk about that: it's solid and surprisingly broad. You're able to swing from side to side, thrust forward, overhead attack, charge swings(you can do light attacks and heavy attacks), special attack (dependent on the weapon), kick to break blocks, interrupt enemy attacks, riposte, dodge, morph attacks, and feint attacks. And depending on your class you have additional moves as well: the footman can do massive damage with a charge attack, but it can be blocked or dodged, though blocking this attack will leave the player open to a normal attack. The knight tackles, which same deal, leave the person you hit open to attack if they block it, but if they don't they take minor damage and their ass is knocked to the dirt for a painful few seconds where you can get a free hit on them. And then finally there's a sprint attack for the vanguard which is a really powerful and quick leaping-slash that can often one shot people if it's done from behind. Your class, of which their are four to choose from (archer, vanguard, knight, and footman) also have three additional sub-classes which come with special perks that charge over time. These perks would be the horn, which is an AOE healing effect, flags, also an AOE healing effect though its far less effective but continuous until the flag is destroyed, medkits, which heal a lot for one person, firebombs,  which burn people, and fortifications and traps. The latter perks are often the least used. 

So, to summarize all of that real fast: you can do a lot already with just your weapon, but your weapon also has a special attack, YOU have a special running attack (unless you're an archer), and you get some sort of perk that charges over time which can often turn the tide of a fight. Not to mention just like in Mordhau you can accelerate and drag your sword swings by turning with your attack and practicing good footwork, and that is on top of already being able to charge your swings which would delay an attack already.

 Speaking of Mordhau, let's talk about that too: the combat in Chiv not as intricate as Mordhau's, but I honestly don't think this is a bad thing. It's far easier to grasp for noobs. As a level 20 I was steamrolling people in the triple digits. Granted playing Mordhau religiously probably gave me an edge here, I've had the same happen to me now that I'm level 100-something.  The combat is also far harder to abuse too: like in Mordhau people can still feint spam, but because you're no longer only able to parry and can effectively hold a block their animation manipulation isn't nearly as damning and generally punishes only themselves. That being said you do have a "block meter" which will gradually empty the longer you keep up a defensive stance and when you actually block an enemy's attack. The larger the weapon or the heavier the swing the larger portion of your meter will go down. If your meter goes down, you're disarmed, and if the actual swing of the weapon (the damage is increased) goes past your block meter threshold you take damage as well. That being said, feint spamming is pretty worthless because you'd only be wasting your own stamina, not your enemies. It's far more effective to just hit them with your weapon than to try and snake-eyes every millisecond, and that's just how I like it.

The battles are cool, down right cinematic at times, there's events almost every week, and the chaos generated from the battles is just awesome. The only thing that I think is lackluster is the game modes: there's TDM 1v1, 3v3, 20v20, and 32v32. Respectively, there is also a death-match, which can also have 64 players max. Those are pretty insane. There is a gamemode where you can ride horses, which is alright I guess. The weekly events are neat: brawls, bar fights, and archer-only fights are welcome. There's no true PVE gamemode besides offline practice and the tutorial. Training grounds is a thing, but it's technically PVP/PVE cause there's 15 bots on each side, plus 10 players tossed in, five on each side respectively. 

I really don't have much to say about the game con wise. The fashion is lackibng, but what's there, most of it anyways, is really cool looking. Nothing is really pay to win, it's just cosmetic. Some armors can't even be paid for with real money which is pretty rare now-a-days.

Still, the experience itself is consistently fun and casual enough for anyone to enjoy.

Starting out as a new player can be frustrating as the game will put you in lobbies with people that have hundreds of hours but it doesn't take long to get used to the fighting. One of the few medieval slasher games that I like, it can get frustrating at times, but not near as frustrating as games like For Honor can get. 

Bit pricey but if you enjoy medieval fighting games and have seen gameplay I'd say its 100% worth the price.

Not recommended for new players. If you can demo it on a free weekend, have at it. But please don't invest your money in a multiplayer game with a dying playerbase. If you don't play at peak hours, you're more often than not stuck with 4 v 5 in a 64 player map. Yep. As of today, just one laggy server is barely able to be filled (sadly a quarter of those players will be AFK) and that's only if the lone working server doesn't crash. 

The devs rarely update their own game and when they do it's half-baked ideas (ex: the terribly implemented mounted combat mode is a ghost town and long abandoned by the community). The game breaking (stuck in animations - unable to attack or defend and constant map loading crashes, anyone?) and QoL bugs that never get addressed just make you wonder if they care. 

Finally, if you do get a rare match going, the majority of the maps are unbalanced. Ex: You can run off not playing the obj as an attacker on Dark Forest and still win. And because all the level 500-1000 players teamswitch to the winning side, you can be stuck on a team full of newbies and console players (no communication) who can't coordinate. Just a poorly thought-out and ill-maintained product.

If you're going into this game with a mostly for-fun mindset, then you will absolutely love this game. I just play this game super casually and its been a blast. To me, this game feels like a medieval battlefield (the good ones). The battles are immersive, the combat is clean, and the visuals are pretty damn good. From a gameplay perspective, this game is wickedly fun. Is this game perfect? Not even close. There will be sweats in this game, there are balance issues, and the community is kinda toxic. But generally, if you just play for fun knowing this game has it's issues, you'll have a blast.

To start, the big team battles are fun and well done. The atmosphere as you charge a castle or raid a village is fantastic. Friend and foe screaming and fighting as far as the eye can see. I understand why people love this game, but at the same time the sheer number of small negatives drowns out the positives. I find myself thinking "I wish I was playing Battlefield right now."

The biggest problems I have with it are around the combat and movement of the characters. As an example, one move available is a push kick which will stun the target, but only if they are blocking the attack. What kind weak bitch gets stunned by a push kick that they block with a metal shield? Why am I being punishing for being fast enough to recognize an attack is coming and blocking the damage? It's like the developers were going for decent realism as a whole, but just randomly decided that some aspects should be totally unrealistic.

I have seen plenty of reviews talking about the matchmaking and it's failures, so I will simply say 'yeah' and move on.
I have seen plenty of reviews talking about the menu and party system, so I will simply say 'yeah' and move on.

At the end of the day, there are just too many small, bad things that I have to ignore or suffer through and the good is just not worth it. There are far better big battle games out there to enjoy with your friends.

The sequel to the original Chivalry appears to maintain a high standard with regard to the player's freedom of choice, imaginative scope, and coordination during combat. However, it may prove to be a daunting experience for new players who are matched up against enemy players with significantly higher levels (300 or more), and equipped with only rudimentary weapons and a dearth of usable equalizers on the battlefield. Moreover, the in-game store appears to be a vehicle for pushing players towards purchasing downloadable content, ostensibly for both cosmetic and level-progression purposes.

While the Chivalry 2 community does seem to possess a certain level of camaraderie, it is predominantly comprised of individuals in their early to mid-teens, along with a significant number of individuals who could be characterized as deplorable eccentrics. In summary, Chivalry 2 can be described as a compelling way to pass the time, and its gameplay can be quite captivating once one has acclimated oneself to its flow. Nevertheless, it is a game that is clearly not suitable for everyone and demands numerous hours of gameplay to attain proficiency.

Gave this a chance as I used to sink time into Chivalry 1. Not worth it. Game has no sensible combat - devolves into a back and forth until stamina depletes and one of you gets disarmed...then they draw a weapon and block your next attack anyways. (Even better, get that blue counter only to get blocked...what's the point of timing anything other than to save a little stamina)

Archers got the shaft, no pun intended. 3-4 arrows to kill any class that isn't an archer unless you become a god of headshots - which still takes 2-3 hits to kill someone. Meanwhile, captain full plate runs up without making a sound and one shots you with a 90 damage attack.

Even more fun yet: People throwing items at you nonstop because there is no time involved to pick something up. Legit a strategy to use a crate to kill someone.

Capstone it with a level locked system for classes to get the more effective weapons and a new player gets to drag their member through glass just to get on an even playing field.

Not sure why this has any popularity when Mordhau has a much better combat system and kit system.

(Warning to those that do purchase and try to refund: There's a crash handler that pops up every time you close the game. This kept me in my game overnight without me knowing and I now may be stuck with this stinking pile of trash...*sighs*)

Chivalry 2 is an amazing game that is perfect for anyone who loves action, adventure and medieval battles. As an AI, I do not have personal feelings, opinions or experiences with the game, but from what I have gathered from other players and reviews, the graphics are incredible, the gameplay is immersive and engaging, and the complexity of the combat system adds a layer of strategy that keeps the game exciting.

Players have praised the game for its attention to detail, with rich and immersive battlefield environments, realistic weapon mechanics, a great variety of character classes and customization options. The game takes players on a journey through medieval Europe, allowing them to experience the epic battles and sieges that defined the era, including the Hundred Years War and the Battle of Agincourt.

Overall, Chivalry 2 is an engaging and immersive game that is perfect for gamers who love intense battles and a strong dose of history. Its attention to detail, complex combat system and incredible graphics make it a must-play for anyone who wants to experience a truly epic medieval adventure.

Something about the melee combat with dodges and parries makes me feel more alive then actual physical activities.

Game breaking glitches that will never be fixed, lets just add more broken maps and broken hit boxes. This game has everything else to make it so fun, but the glaring glitches and clipping issues on maps just makes it un-fun to play or can just make you tilt off the planet. I honestly worry for my mental health when I play this game, no other game makes me as upset as this one can, because of moments where my hit won't land, or somehow the enemy has timing advantage despite weapon speed, or i get caught on some badly clipped rock or stone that prevents my character from moving in any direction, or situations where my teammate is downed but because of some revive glitch I cannot lift him back up and just watch him die before my eyes.

At least in other games when I get upset, it is at my opponent or maybe a weapon is overpowered and should be nerfed, or cheaters, etc. But with this game there have been too many times where I have actually felt CHEATED out of winning a duel or fight because of a glitch. Every dev diary is just mentioning new maps and new content, nothing about addressing issues like where the siege ramps don't properly fold out and cause players to get clipped at the top, etc. Honestly pretty disappointing when there are so many glaring issues with this game engine and how it interacts with the game. Like trying to throw a med kit to a teammate, the engine is so broken and the hitboxes are so messed up that if you accidentally misthrow even SLIGHTLY, your medkit will go flying in the total opposite direction or just bounce flying in some random direction if it hits a teammate with full health. How is something so basic like this still in the game? Why not just have the med kits deaden upon impact and fall to the ground and stay there? at least i could pick them back up and try throwing them again. Another situation that is similar is if a teammate blows their trumpet/horn to heal their teammates at the same time as you, thus negating the effect of your horn and only one of you gets points. There shouldn't be situations where you just waste your trumpet if no teammates can even be healed, it should at least come back half full if not a single person is healed, thus allowing you to get it faster, or something else that can balance this effect. Sometimes the refresh can be minutes on this, just making it that much more irritating when it happens.

I could go on and on, but the point being that I'm sure many of these issues have been around since the start of the game and it doesn't feel like they ever plan on being addressed. I've honestly decided to uninstall this game and no longer play it until I hear about some progress being made on these glaring issues for the actual gameplay and balance between teams. If some progress is made on this, I would be more than happy to change this to a positive review! The gore is fun, the humor is dark, the voice acting is both amazing and terrible, mostly in good ways but maybe re-record some of them? they actually sound like they are recorded on different quality microphones for some of the base voices... (The voice acting itself is great, I'll miss being the Highlander!!!)
Lots of metal clangs and brutal contest of fortitude, massive teams and battlefields give the realism and odds of making it through an entire battle alive. Let alone a campaign.

It doesn´t have as much of a skill ceiling as Chivalry 1, but it also doesn´t have as many exploits (the back hammer/messer swing from Chivalry 1 is gone for instance). Overall, I find it very enjoyable. What deserves particular praise is the map design - no shortcuts were taken, every map feels unique and even all the objectives feel unique, so bonus points there. 

What bugs me the most are the hitboxes. I have stable connection with 30-40 ping and no packet loss and yet you will find lot of hits that on your screen go through the middle of opponent´s chest somehow miss. This goes for spears, javelins, overhead swings etc. Also, it somehow feels it is getting worse. One extremely annoying "feature" is the ability of opponents to block your swing behind their back when they are starting their swing. It will happen often that the opponent does this without having any idea that you are swinging at him.

These gripes don´t however spoil the general positive experience with the game. Money well spent.

I love this game, but there are some bugs. Sometimes you spawn and fall through the map. Character customization is bad. Your character customization resets itself and you have to redo it multiple times a day if you play a lot. Arrows are not consistent with where you shoot. There's a white line of where it should've gone and it didn't go there at all. Sometimes arrows don't do damage even though it makes hit noises. you can enter the game and not be the character that you customized. I died twice today to invisible fire pits on a convoy course. It didn't say anyone killed me and I staggered every time I hit the fire pit. Some construction items like ladders and catapults can only be constructed from very specific spots on the items themselves in some maps. It's just a bunch of minor things and I really enjoy this game, but these minor things are starting to get very bothersome, mainly just the projectile inaccuracies and character menu issues. I've been wanting to play chivalry for about ten years after watching it for so long. I got the game and am surprised that this company is willing to sell a game with such obvious issues and not fix it. Great game though, just have to take a break every few rounds to stop being frustrated.

[Edit] All of these issues were fixed. I love this game

I hated the first one and the War of Roses back in the early 2010's. The scale of combat felt too small (felt like 5 people were fighting 5 people in a massive battlefield).

The scale of combat in this game feels just right. Although there are only about 30 people on each side, the map design, sounds of swords clanging in the distance and overall chaos when fighting people makes it feel like you're fighting in a large scale battle similar to Mount and Blade. They really nailed the feeling of medieval combat (with added humour to boot).

My only gripe about the game is that the only modes available at the moment are two sides fighting each other similar to a typical Battlefield match. It would be cool to have a story mode with this style of hack n slash combat. If not that, a horde mode would be interesting as well.

They added battle passes in this game with the Winter update and I'm not sure what to make of it. In the past, you could either pay real money to buy in-game skins if you didn't want to go through the hassle of levelling up to the unlock level of the item. It was not a requirement, though. With the battle pass, you do have to pay for the items. They seem to be following suit to Halo Infinite in terms of battle passes: they will always be available to purchase long after that season's over. You can choose which one you want to level in the future.

In terms of player numbers, a lot of people play this game. It's cross-platform, so Steam numbers aren't really accurate. Even if the game had 0 players, it could still be a fun experience with bots. In fact, I enjoy playing against bots & players as it has this League of Legends-type of feel. When you encounter another player, it is difficult to end them, but bots in high numbers can also be a threat. Individually, bots are easy to fight, though.

I give the game a 10/10. Very few games like it on the market. Mount and Blade Bannerlord didn't really scratch the itch for me: that game had a lot of time-sink qualities to it. This game brings you straight into the action.

With its amazing graphics and attention to detail, the game successfully immerses players in a realistic medieval atmosphere. It also features some elements inspired by Monty Python, making it even more entertaining.

The first thing that stands out about Chivalry 2 is its stunning visuals. The game's graphics are incredibly detailed, with lifelike characters, beautiful landscapes, and realistic weapons and armor. Every aspect of the game looks like it was taken straight from medieval times, giving players an immersive experience they won't soon forget.

The game also features elements and charismatic humor that players can expect to see an array of with an amusing player base and humorous dialogue throughout their journey through the medieval world of Chivalry 2. This adds a unique twist to the game that makes it even more enjoyable for fans of the medieval age as well as those who simply appreciate an amazing game built to immerse.

Overall Chivalry 2 is a highly anticipated video game that brings players back to the medieval age. It features beautiful graphics and detailed environments that accurately recreate the look and feel of a medieval battlefield. The game also has a humorous twist, with references to Monty Python movies and other comedic elements. Chivalry 2 promises to be an exciting and unique experience for gamers everywhere.

overall i'd recommend this game if you wanna have a fun casual medieval battle game. i'll list some pros/cons below:

pros
-there's minimal grinding for gear, so you start on a fairly even playing field (not pay to win/grind to win)
-controls make sense and is easy to pick up, so you're not at a huge disadvantage against someone with 300 hours in the game once you have like 5 hours under your belt
-maps are well-designed for the most part, very beautiful and make you feel like you're in an epic battle
-cleaving off someone's head with a battle ax is extremely satisfying

cons
-archers (cowards, fun to kill though)
-projectiles in general (fire bombs, catapults, etc)
-a few maps have really lame objectives (either they're too easy for one side or just relatively boring)
-the devs haven't gone brazy enough with their maps/objectives -- i'd love to see something truly crazy in one of the maps, like maybe the final checkpoint is killing a dragon or some crazy shit like that, it's a game, might as well go wild!
-most people can't play as a team and will leave you hanging at the worst times, don't rely on ANYONE unless you're playing with friends
-ONLY UP TO 4 PLAYERS IN A PARTY?!?!?! this one is so dumb, hope they expand the party size ASAP

Good fun but wait for a sale (which is easy enough because it's 50% off every month). You're pretty much guaranteed to have a good time when you open the game.

The player count is stable and there's no shortage of new players, but don't expect every playlist to always be playable outside of peak hours.
Fighting is fun of course but it has weird collision issues where enemies swings can go through you and miss (or so it seems). This, ironically, can get you killed.

Regardless of how good you are you will be relying on your team. Unfortunately, the game is in dire need of a team balance system. Sometimes there will be several triple-digit level players on one team and none on the other. You can guess which team will win 100% of the time. In this scenario you're best off either quitting and finding another match, or trying to swap teams. Sure, the game can be fun while losing, but the situation puts a damper on things [i]even if you're on the decimating team[/i]. It simply isn't as fun as having a close and balanced match.

Speaking of unfair situations, for some reason lagging players have a major advantage. When they lose connection they become invincible, continuously walk forwards, then teleport back to where they were. It's pretty ridiculous when you and a teammate are chasing down a player who proceeds to demanifest, reappear behind you, then kill you. I'm really not sure why the client gets to tell the server where the player is after lagging rather than the other way around but what do I know.

Anyway, good game.

It's an excellent game overall; the problems I can see are the crossplay functionality has been "on the roadmap" for over a year with no attention. Some of their servers are just you, and sometimes you get sent to a server across the nation with a horrible ping for a match. Be prepared to be matched with people 300 to 600 levels higher than you in almost every game type. There needs to be more level balancing. The main thing that makes this game interesting is the customization. They also have three different emote wheels, leading to many fun interactions with the community. The combat system is my favorite fighting-style game I've ever played. There are three different attack types and alt attacks. If you see what your opponent is throwing, you can counter it infinitely if you do it right. However, each weapon has a different range, wind up, and damage. Learning new weapons and how they feel allows you to get much extra game time. Lastly, I would like to mirror some of the other reviews. Don't pay the full price for this game; it may be fun, but the player base has been here for years, and as much as I would love to see other new people, the game isn't worth the price.

List of stuff wrong with the game, some are due to poor developers, some are due to lazy developers.
-Ducking costs no stamina, makes no sense, everything else does, but squatting wearing a 100lbs of armor and weaponry, nope.
-Matchmaking non-existant, hope you're a fast learner, you're going to go up against lvl 1000 people with 500hrs in the game at level 1.
-Hit-detection is wrecked, even though the game is years, swings don't connect, players block attacks on their back even though they are facing the opposite direction.
-The developers add some new maps every once in a while, unfortunately, the latest map is an absolute FPS destroyer, very poorly optimized.
-For some odd design choice reason, your weapon, if it's bladed, will pass through the enemy unencumbered, even though it doesn't kill them, just does damage.  Which is fine, however the same does not happen to allies.  You can swing with a fully charge sword the size of an ironing board and it will not pass through friendlies, which makes being around team mates a liability.
-Fire bombs are thrown and don't explode
There is a holdout map, Coxwell, that has been "fixed" at least 5 times that I've seen.  It's not fixed, it has never been fixed.  At this point I don't expect it to ever be fixed.
-The maps are heavily unbalanced, obviously favoring the defender, however as far as re-spawn timers go and distance to the point to attack/defend needs to be revisited across all maps.
-Archers should be limited to 1/10 of the population, they are a liability.

This game is by far my favorite melee fighting game. Everytime I play, i find something new or funny happening. Want to fight off a horde of attackers with a flute? Chiv 2. How about launch yourself into battle with a catapult? Chiv 2. Want to duel people by smacking them in the face with a bow? Chiv 2. This is the most fun I've ever had with this type of game.

Besides the silly stuff, it also has a really simple yet deep combat system. You won't find many people spinning and glitching through blocks like in the original Chivalry. The skill ceiling is high, but a relatively new player will still be able to win one over on an experienced player on a regular basis. The gamemodes are fun, with objective maps and FFA being the main 2. BUY THIS GAME!!!

Having wasted 3000 hours of my life on the first instalment, I thought it was a no-brainer that I would enjoy this game. But alas, my enjoyment of the game ended with the tutorial.

[h1]Bad[/h1]

❌ [b]No matchmaking[/b]. I thought this wouldn’t be a big deal for me personally as I spent so much time on the first game, but the prior experience I had did not do me many favors. Frustratingly, a lot of the time when I responded to an incoming attack using the muscle memory I had from the first game, my character did not do what I expected them to and I ended up dying. Blocking and recovery don’t seem to work the same way at all and I honestly can’t be bothered to relearn an entirely new combat system at this point just to have a small chance against the Rank 853 turbonerds.

❌ [b]FOV is hard capped at 120.[/b] You can’t change it with console commands or by editing config files like you could in the first game. Overall, I guess you could say this is a good thing since it puts everyone on a more even playing field (not really though since there’s no matchmaking, kek) but 120 still feels extremely claustrophobic and makes it hard to play optimally when you can’t see enemies approaching from your sides.

❌ [b]Coat of arms customization from the first game is gone.[/b] Overall there’s a lot more customization, but they’ve inexplicably got rid of the ability to create a custom coat of arms. You can’t even change the color of your FFA outfits. I don’t get this…

❌ [b]64-player servers are once again the main focus, and they’re a mess.[/b] Mordhau tried to make it happen, failed miserably, and now Chivalry 2 seems to be following in their footsteps. I don’t think I’ve ever met anyone who enjoys the chaotic, laggy mess brought about by 64-player servers in games such as these. There are other gamemodes too, as well as a 40-player alternative, but these take longer to find games for — speaking of which, the 3v3 gamemode is dead. It sounded interesting and I wanted to try it, but after waiting 5 minutes for a game and not finding any… I had to call it quits.

❌ [b]Toxic playerbase.[/b] Who's surprised? Because I'm not. I actually found it hilarious that in my very first online match, I, a Rank 2 player, got stomped on by a Rank 400 who then proceeded to t-bag my corpse. A few games later, I saw another player teamkill some poor dude repeatedly because they "thought it was funny". When they tried to votekick him, everyone just voted no and let it keep happening.

[h1]Good[/h1]

✔️ [b]Does chambering better than Mordhau[/b]. Basically, if you want to counter an enemy’s attack by mirroring their attack (i.e. chambering), you have to assume a defensive stance first by holding RMB. I found this much better than Mordhau’s system as it makes it easier to predict that your opponent might be trying to chamber your attack, therefore making the mechanic much more balanced.

✔️ [b]More customization[/b]. You can now change your character’s gender, face, voice, hair, and facial hair. There are also titles and some other stuff that I thought was pretty cool. Well done.

✔️ [b]Good RP elements[/b]. Just like the first game, there’s plenty of potential for fun roleplaying with all the emotes and voice commands. They’ve even brought back a lot of the voices from the first game which is nice.

✔️ [b]Good optimization[/b]. Despite my complaints about 64-player servers, I was surprised by how smoothly the game ran on an RTX 3070 and Ryzen 7 5800X. I didn’t experience any stutters or frame drops and I had smooth ~150 FPS in almost every map. Some maps are a bit laggier than others though, but that was also true for CMW.

✔️ [b]Good graphics[/b]. If you’re someone who’s into good graphics in games, well, Chivalry 2 doesn’t disappoint there. The game looks really nice, there’s no denying that.

In conclusion, despite any of the positives it may have, I can’t recommend this game in good conscience simply due to the lack of matchmaking as it makes it nearly impossible to learn this game. Well, I suppose you still can, but you're not going to have much fun "getting gud" while players with much more experience in the game stomp all over you. If you’re willing to put up with that, go for it. Otherwise, it’s a no from me.

i wish there was a "kinda" option to reviewing games, as i can't reallllly recommend it except at a big discount, the gameplays good but ultra grindy. There's LOADS of jank, WAY more than Mordhaus jank, the mounted combat is a disgrace in comparison to Mordhaus mounted combat, the combat itself is interesting, in some ways superior to Mord, in many ways inferior. No drags and accel bullsh*t though so that's something i enjoy.

The structure of the progressive invasion stages and the combat flow around it is superior to all but Mordhaus best invasion maps, the voice banter is GOOD, but Mord is 12/10 incredible and they were never gonna beat them at that, especially with the new dlc voice pack from Mord.

There are hackers and its hard to deal with, harder than on mordhau, restricting the numbers of archers possible on your team is a great feature though. 

The customisation system is sinfully bad compared to Mordhau. I have my issues with that game but much less than this one. It's a MTX crap show and i don't like it, Mordhau did it better, charging full price for a game means you don't get to lock cosmetics behind paywalls.

Get it if its cheap, OCE users will suffer gameplay wise as there are dedicated servers but not many and they lose pop late at night, but then again so does Mord. 

TL;DR: dont buy if you're in OCE, the game pop is dead, far too low, not worth it.

Even at 8ms ping, its a 50/50 shot your block registers before the server says you got hit. Either you block goes up and you still get hit or your block gets "interrupted" and never goes up at all.

Most of the mechanics the tutorial teaches you just don't work in-game because the servers are garbage.

All the server issues makes this game frustrating to play, and i'm now realizing i stopped having fun a while ago because of these issues.

Fun at times when you are not disbalanced and when it's not "Lost connection to the server" which happens all the times. No clear progression UI-wise: classes have different stats but there is nothing about that in the customization menu. Hitboxes are unclear: I literally see the weapons meet each other, yet somehow I'm hit.

Game is just overall not enjoyable. At first you may find it fun but eventually getting constantly body blocked, interrupted and hit by your team mates from behind gets old. Defence is horrible unbalanced as to make the game a chore. Players constantly switch teams and stack Attack because of this, which makes the problem even worse.Why even let players do that? The combat also is not great. It becomes a gank fest because of the horrible spawn wave system or just a stam battle. When you do get hit it's because the visuals don't match what's actually happening. A lot of animations just seem to be missing. People counter into an alt swing and all you see is the parry animation....and then accel hit. On human benchmark.com my avg reaction time is 160-170ms depending on the day. This shit is unreadable sometimes. My ping is often less than 20.  Hitboxes are horrible too. You get hit like 180 degrees from a horizontal. Overheads hit you when they visually look 3 ft to your left/right. Then on the flip side you can overhead or stab into someone and not get a hit. I think my biggest issue with the game is the animations and the fact that they fundamentally make the game unfun for me as it often feels like a guessing game if someone is parrying or attacking me. All classes and weapons basically die/kill in 3-4 hits which is quite stupid when you consider class differences in stamina and speed and same for weapons. No headshot dmg on melee means there is no point to aim at head which means "matrix" is quite a bit hard as everyone seems to be slightly looking down the fuck with the animations. I've played Chiv1, Mordhau and now this and have to say it's quite insane how the problem with ALL these games is the animation system and after all these years there has been no improvement. I would actually say it's worse. The animations in Chiv1 were choppy which actually made them  easier to read than the smooth floaty ones in Chiv 2 and Mordhau.
if you kinda liked the theme and feel of mordhau but wanted a game that made that sort of combat barable and not so fucking clunky as to be shit than play this game...

As somebody who played and enjoyed the original Chivalry I will say the concept was great for its time. Then Mordau came along. Mordau had all the great elements of Chiv but enhanced combat to feel real, immersive, gritty and entertaining. 

It was hard to go from Mordau to Chiv 2. It almost seemed like a step backward in the evolution of multiplayer medieval combat games. The game is pretty nice looking but the combat just feels incredibly arcady when compared to Mordau. 

If they had made combat more immersive and a little less of a nonstop  button mash with weird animations I think it could be a great game.

Its a really good game overall, problems i can see are the crossplay functionality has been "on the roadmap" for over a year with no attention and some of their servers are just fucked and you have to reque (this one has been slowly getting better) the main thing that i really like about it is the customization, i typically play the 32v32 mode and literally everyone looks different from everybody else if they want to. they also have 3 different emote wheels which leads to a lot of fun interactions with the community. the combat system is my favorite fighting style game ive ever played. basically there are 3 different attack types and if you see what your opponent is throwing you can counter it infinitely if you do it right. however each of the weapons has a different range, wind up and damage (and blunt weapons vs slashing weapons is important depending on what you are going for) this allows you to get a lot of extra game time by simply learning new weapons and how they feel.

TLDR good game, dont pay full price, wait for it to go on sale

The game's developer could be more responsive to fixing issues with the game, but despite all its problems, there's nothing quite as unique and fun as the melee combat and hilarious level design in Chiv 2. There's endless hours of challenge available; there's a huge array of weapons, and they all have their own unique feel that makes the game feel fresh and interesting whenever you switch it up. There's 64 player objective mode (my favorite), 3v3 and 1v1 arena modes, and some time-limited special modes like brawl (fists only). Would recommend.

If you've played Mordhau or Bannerlord; really any medieval game I recommend Chiv 2. It has it's own charm in combat and you can apply what you have learned in other games in this game. Overall I give chivarly 8/10 because it doesn't have competitive and there are some slight stutters and crashes, but regardless of that it is worth the money. The developers care about the franchise and will continue to improve and add new things to the game... Unlike TF2 and Mordhau :(...

Few games can get me so addicted that I can't help but play hundreds of hours right after I buy them,  Chivalry 2 is one of them.

This game introduced me to the medieval slashing genre for the first time. I thought I'd get bored and refund it, but the amazing combat system, massive varieties of classes and weapons and the cinematic large scale combat made it difficult for me to dislike this game at all.

This game is easy to pick up, but there is plenty of space to get good as well. Competitive gameplay is there, but Chivalry 2 has a relatively goofy theme, it encourages you to just throw yourself into the battle with your teammates. Cooperate with your team and play the objective, it is hard not to have fun and get addicted to the immersive medieval warfare.

There are problems here and there, and the game devs do not look promising with their support, but as long as Chivalry 2 holds the crown of the absolute best of this genre, I have no problems recommending it to others.

Fun first person melee. Draws upon combo'ing and street fighter-type skills, though with a mouse and keyboard. The base fighting game is amazingly solid and fun. Skill makes or breaks 1v1 fights. Insane dopamine rush when you manage to win a 1v2 or 1v3 typically against less skilled opponent, and always a solid dopamine rush when you finally slay a good opponent after a lengthy 1v1.

Very cool cosmetic customization that is adequately paced with just playing the game - you don't feel forced to spend money on cosmetics.

Maps are slight blemish on the overall game as they are a bit steamrolly and are easier for the attackers, but a significant amount of defender maps are designed with the final stage defending a king, and the top defensive player gets to be the king, and you can indeed sometimes single-handedly carry your defensive team in such scenarios, despite what would otherwise be a steamroll

[table][tr][th][h2]Pros 👍🏻[/h2][/th][th][h3]Cons 👎🏻[/h3][/th][/tr]
[th][list]
 [*]Great graphics
 [*]Variety of weapons and armors
 [*]Good combat system
 [*]Realistic medieval experience
 [*]Multiple game modes and maps
 [*]Frequent updates
 [*]Easy for newcomers to learn and play
[/th][th][list]
 [*]Minor bugs
 [*]No interesting progression or goals
 [*]No multiplayer clans or global player rankings
 [*]Corny lore/factions
[/th][/table]

[quote]Liked this review? Check out more of my reviews [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/pyro77/recommended/] [b]here[/b][/url]![/quote]

[h1]🎮 Gameplay[/h1]

[i]Chivalry 2[/i] offers you an opportunity to experience all the grit and gore as if you were a medieval soldier caught up in battle centuries ago.  Players can select a few different modes to play, mounted, mixed or 1v1/3v3. In a normal mixed game, two teams of 32 players face off on a variety of different maps, each with its own goal list and introductions. Each map has unique goals that must be achieved by the end of a timer by the attackers.
  
Combat is fun and exhilarating. You can choose between four classes of infantry, and weaponry for each class. Each selection will have different benefits to your combat. The stamina mechanic allows you to sustain quite a few attacks before you get mauled, which I found was a nice way to reflect real medieval fighting (ie. Exhaustion is the main weakness). After dying, the action is just a short distance away from your respawn, so you can jump back in – literally. [i]Chivalry 2[/i] does not give in to the trope about medieval armor being really heavy and burdensome. In the game, you are able to sprint, jump, kick and dodge attacks, all off which requiring a small amount of stamina.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933694003

The learning process is very simple and straight-forward. The tutorial is quick to complete, and you can see the controls again anytime by pressing F1. You will, however, be mashing a lot of keys, so a good gaming keyboard is recommended. 

Gameplay is very inviting and fun, and [i]Chivalry 2[/i] does a good job at offering a realistic medieval fighting experience to players. I do, however, think the decision not to use more historically based factions and battles was a detracting factor, although minor. Real factions and battles would have made [i]Chivalry 2[/i] stand out incredibly amongst its cohorts. There is lore but I have not dove deeply into it, it has no impact on the game, as there is no single-player story. Each map is paired with another to represent an ‘eye for an eye’ type of feeling. If the Masons attack Agatha in one map, the next map will have the Argathians getting their revenge. There are over 15 maps that you can play currently.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933691695

You can create a party and play with your friends, but there is no in-game clan feature or way to add friends (without adding on Steam). Cross-play is available for those who want to play with friends using different platforms.

[h1]💻 Graphics[/h1]

Visually, the game looks spectacular and is very detailed. Buildings are especially well done, and for the most part historically accurate. Small details, such as fire animations and dust are also are very nice. Each little detail further adds to an immersive experience.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2933271145 

Building destruction animations play out very smoothly and also look amazing. Although it would be nice if more things were destructible.

I do not have any recommendations, apart from adding some more armor-coloring options.
[h1]🎶 Sounds[/h1]

Every sound you would expect to hear on a medieval battlefield is present in [i]Chivalry 2[/i]. Each slash or block makes a different noise. Crackling fires and the screams of dying soldiers fill the air almost constantly, with catapults or ballistae adding to the symphony of war. Could be improved by adding more background screams from “peasants” and barking dogs/hissing cats. Also, if [i]Chivalry[/i] had used real-life factions, different languages would have been a bonus.

[h1]👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Audience[/h1]

[i]Chivalry 2[/i] contains strong violence, decapitations, mutilations and gore, which make it mostly unsuitable for younger children or more sensitive people. 
It is aimed at people who are interested in the Medieval Era.

[h1]🔥 Performance[/h1]

System: Gigabyte G5 KD (11th Gen i5 11400H + RTX 3060 6GB 105W)

I was able to play [i]Chivalry 2[/i] with ‘Epic’ graphics settings at a maximum of 90FPS stably (I personally limit to 70FPS with PL1 40W, PL2 45W and Turbo 28W on my CPU to keep temps in 80s) at 1080x1920 resolution.

I did not encounter many bugs, although I had the occasional crash. Every time I exit the game, the Unreal crash report comes up but it does not affect the game in any way.
[i]Chivalry 2[/i] is quite demanding, but can be played on weaker systems as long as graphics and effects are set to a minimum. If you are using a gaming laptop, make sure it is elevated and cap the CPU wattage if temperatures are concerning. 

[h1]❓ Conclusion[/h1]

[i]Chivalry 2[/i] is an excellent example of medieval warfare, and will keep you occupied for many hours. But this comes at a cost, as [i]Chivalry 2[/i] is priced at 40USD. I would recommend waiting until the next 50% off sale. The developers are constantly updating the game and there is an active Discord community, so you do not need to worry about the game becoming inactive any time soon.

[h1]✅ Overall rating: 8/10[/h1]

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.
